story:
What's the project?

Hello! I'm Cat Gerrard. I’m a theatre-maker, director and the new Artistic Director of Sirius Arts which is focussed on colliding performance forms - especially physical, devised theatre & new writing - to best tell the relevant stories of today in a theatrical, exciting way. We also want to make work for audiences who might not normally come to the theatre or have their stories told by theatre-makers.

We want to talk about immigration. We want to shake up theatre.

Red Sky at Night started as a 20 minute piece commissioned by the Bush Theatre, London. We are expanding it to an hour-long piece, a bold, physical exploration of a lyrical and crackling text about something that really matters. Our campaign is to raise the bare minimum expenses for 3 weeks of rehearsal and a week long work-in-progress run to get crucial feedback to propel the production onwards.

Red Sky at Night is about immigration, money and the literal alien invasion of London. The entire creative team are migrants. Red Sky is trying to put the voice of migrants on stage in a way that is recognisable and honest. It’s trying to rebalance the language and the stories around immigration.

It’s trying to rattle the cage of capitalism. It’s a homage to cities, especially London, at night.

Where does the money go?

Our target of £2888 covers really the bare bones to make the project happen.

Rehearsal expenses
We're paying £75 per team member per week as expenses. 
3 performers & 1 director x 3 weeks (12 lots of £75)
1 playwright x 2 weeks (2 lots) 
1 stage manager/lighting designer x 1 week (1 lot).
That’s 15 lots of £75 which is £1125.
1 producer working at £75 per week x 6 weeks. That’s £450.

Production expenses
3 performers, 1 director & 1 stage manager £75 each x 1 week. 
That’s 5 x £75 so £375.

Marketing and publicity costs
The wonderful illustration, by Nanna Koekoek is £100. 
Printed flyers & posters, as required by the venue comes to £130.

Venue fee
We’re being charged £1800 for the week. We’ve projected we can raise £1400 from ticket sales – working at a conservative but typical London fringe estimate of 40% capacity each night. We need to make up the shortfall so we are adding the remaining £400 to our campaign.

Indiegogo fee 
5% of the money raised (£145) plus Paypal and credit card fees (£25).

Perks
Including £25 for Red Sky badges, £30 for prints of Nanna Koekoek's brilliant illustrations, £43 envelopes/stamps, £40 for international postage. Total £138

We have some brilliant perks that you cannot get anywhere else! Illustrations from Nanna Koekoek, palm-reading from playwright and professional palm-reader Eve Leigh, a copy of the (as yet unpublished) play text, a personal storytelling session with director/storyteller Cat Gerrard. Get in there quick!

Why Red Sky at Night?

This is a critical step in this important project. We have the fantastic support of the Old Red Lion Theatre, one of the most established and exciting fringe venues in London, and we have the opportunity to get incredibly valuable feedback from an audience before developing the piece further. We need your support now to get the ball rolling.

Other ways you can help!

If you can’t donate, you can still help us! Please spread this far and wide! & follow us: https://siriusartstheatre.wordpress.com | FB: SiriusArts | Twitter: @sirius_arts

Join our mailing list or get in touch. We'd love to hear from you. Just drop us a line here: siriusartstheatre@gmail.com

story:
Y nuestro sueño es que queremos llevar el proyecto a Madrid

Y sin ningún tipo de ayudas llevar nuestro espectáculo a Madrid desde Barcelona es casi imposible y necesitamos tu colaboración para poder llevar allí a las 8 personas que formamos el equipo.

Qué vas a ver? Un espectáculo multisensorial creado para soñar despierto, que te transportará a otros lugares sin moverte de tu asiento durante 45 minutos. Un show acompañado de un excelente vino tinto que podrás degustar durante el espectáculo:

https://vimeo.com/114356639

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes.

Solo pedimos que compres tu entrada anticipadamente, para cubrir todos los gastos que supone llevar el espectáculo a Madrid. Esta "taquilla anticipada" nos servirá de aval para encontrar el teatro adecuado en Madrid.

¿Fecha?

En principio la fecha de la actuación (o actuaciones si la "taquilla anticipada" supera las espectativas) será entre el 15 de noviembre de este año y el 15 de enero de 2016

¿No puedes venir ese día?

Si finalmente no puedes venir a ver el espectáculo podrás canjear tu entrada por 2 botellas de vino Girasomnis en un punto de recogida en el centro de Madrid.

¿Se podrán comprar las entradas luego en taquilla?

Si, pero más caras y es ahora cuando necesitamos tu ayuda.


¿No vives en Madrid pero quieres apoyarnos?

Comparte esta campaña o también puedes invitar a tus amigos por este evento de facebook.

Gracias de corazon!! Nos vemos en Madrid!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

----

Sponsors/Colaboradores de la campaña:

VjSpain
IED Madrid
PIOVRA

----

GIRASOMNIS CREW:

Idea original, dirección, diseño visual, y música:

Paco Gramaje

Danza y coreografía:

Melissa Marín Luis, Nadia Pesarrodona, Anna Fontanet, Javier Casado,  Mireia Piñol, Barbara Fritsche y Javier Muñoz.

Postprodución y efectos 3D:

Raj Davsi y Paco Gramaje

Vestuario:

Jasanzo y Juliet D ́Abreu

Maquillaje:

Josie Moon

Fotografía:

Karreres Fotografía y Enric Climent

Bodega:

Antonio Arraez S.L.

Equipo técnico:

Ricardo Hermida y Cincomilisegundos

Comunicación:

Nerea Unzueta

---

story:
Help us put on a Two Day Drama School for unemployed people

3 days ago our Edinburgh Fringe play, Confessional by Tennessee Williams, was going to be cancelled as a sponsor had pulled out. You saved us by giving over £3,500 in 3 days. 

Thank you! We are genuinely moved by the support we got in such a short space of time.

Now we want to bring back a project we had to cut, the Two Day Drama School for youth and long-term unemployed people.

The Two Day Drama School project will give up to 30 young and long-term unemployed people two days of professional acting training.  5 people will then be picked by audition for a shared part in the play you helped to save, Confessional by Tennessee Williams.

The project aims at helping unemployed people build confidence and gain practical skills that will help them in job interviews, as well as giving them a chance to try acting.

5 unemployed people who will complete the Two Day Drama School will share the role of a police officer on different nights through the second half of Confessional’s 24 nights run at the Edinburgh Fringe 2015. 

The play, which is set in a seaside bar, follows the fortunes of a group of low-lifes through the course of a single evening.

What the Two Day Drama School will cover

The Two Day Drama School will give up to 30 youth and long-term unemployed people in Scotland a flavour of the traditional conservatoire drama school training.  We'll cover:

  • Different acting techniques, such as Stanislavsky and Method Acting, Meisner, and Michael Chekhov.
  • Voice and accent work.
  • Movement work. 
  • Shakespeare.
  • Analysing text and line learning.
  • Industry knowledge and audition technique.
Drama school is every bit as crazy as you probably imagine. You spend time rolling around on the floor, pretending to be seaweed. You find yourself with your head on a middle aged man's thigh, while you act out a scene from a surrealist painting. You learn about your body and your voice. You learn how to experience emotions you never knew you had, and to explore the most sublime words ever written.
As well as being a really fun experience, this will help build the students' confidence, and give them transferable skills. After all if you can project your voice on stage and come across confident in auditions, then it will make interviews a lot easier.
After they've completed the training, anyone who wants to will be invited to audition to share a small part in Confessional by Tennessee Williams, the play you helped to save.
It's a 4-line part of a police officer, which can be taken on by any gender, age, or ethnicity, and we'll aim to give 4 or 5 people a go at taking on the role for 2 or 3 nights each.
Jack Silver, the play's director: “We were always as excited about the Two Day Drama School as we are about putting on Confessional.  We would be honoured to be able to give people the chance of experiencing acting and to be able to help them gain the confidence that it can bring: this is a highly useful transferrable skill. It’s not necessarily about turning out 30 professional actors, but if we find the next Ewan McGregor or Karen Gillan, we’ll be delighted.”

We are were screwed.. but you saved us

3 days ago we were screwed.  Our main sponsor had pulled out and we had no way to afford to put our play, Confessional by Tennessee Williams, on at the Edinburgh Fringe.

But..

Our amazing group of friends saved the show. 

In less than 3 days an amazing group of 103 people donated £3,580 to help save the show.

We are gobsmacked. We are so, so thankful.

And now we've seen how how amazing the support has been, we're going to be cheeky and ask for more.

But there's a good reason.

One of the really, really tough decisions we had to make last week was to cut an amazing project we were hoping to put on the Two Day Drama School.

The Two Day Drama School had always been something we wanted to put on. It would be amazing to give something back to Edinburgh and to a group of disadvantaged people.

But last week when we were facing the prospect of not even having a play at Edinburgh, trying to organise a drama workshop seemed impossible.

It hurt us to cut it. But we had no choice.

But this week we've seen the impossible happen. In 3 days. So we'd like to push our luck and see if we can make the impossible happen twice in a week.

The Impact

If we can put the Two Day Drama School on it'll help a group of disadvantaged people in Edinburgh get some much-needed confidence, something to put on their CV, and some transferable skills that might just help them land a second interview or even a job.  And you never know, we might just uncover the next Hollywood A-Lister!

What is Confessional?

Confessional is like getting to sit in an episode of Eastenders, except it’s the best episode ever, as it was written by Tennessee Williams.

Confessional is a one-act play set in a seaside bar which Tennessee wrote towards the end of his career. It's a superbly-written play about a group of wonderful, broken characters over the course of a single evening.  We're restaging Confessional in a modern British seaside pub (think Blackpool or Southend) and the play will be semi-immersive, so the audience can sit and drink while the action unfolds around them.

"Out of brokenness shines unexpected beauty"

The cast of Confessional by Tennessee Williams is:

  • Lizzie Stanton as Leona Dawson
  • Ray Bethley as Monk
  • Joshua Leese as Bill McCorkle
  • Simone Somers-Yeates as Violet
  • Jackie Lam  and Chris Mills sharing the role of Steve
  • Abi McLoughlin as Doc
  • Tommy Rowlands as the Young Man
  • Ben Moos-Golding as the Boy
  • A Two Day Drama School Student as the Police Officer

Here's the blurb from the fringe programme..

"Share a drink with a group of shameless lowlifes and watch their lives implode. This innovative, immersive production reimagines Tennessee Williams's play in a British seaside bar, frequented by life's flotsam and jetsam. Join the regulars over the course of a furious and fun evening, as a pair of strangers enters their world and all hell breaks loose. 

"Written in 1970, Confessional features Williams's first openly gay character and arguably his most sympathetic female character: needy beautician, Leona."

story:
About the project...

Ballerina, teacher, mentor - Donita Nahon has choreographed her most exquisite dances to the late composer Emile Waldteufel for more than 30 years. 

In March 2014, after viewing Donita’s exemplary work on YouTube, Yvon Waldteufel extended a special invitation to Donita Ballet School to perform dances Espana and Tres Jolie on October 11th, 2015 in Bischheim, France to commemorate the 100th year anniversary of his great-grand-uncle’s passing in the city where the artist was born.

The dancers invited to perform in France are eleven young women with emerging careers in the arts. Among them, graduates and current students of Ryerson Dance, York University Dance and George Brown Dance. Invested in Canadian dance culture, the invited dancers oversee artistic collectives, teach in dance schools across southern Ontario and work for dance companies to gain professional experience. 

Performing in this showcase internationally is a once in a lifetime opportunity and a dream come true for the members of Donita Ballet School.

We need your help!

Donita Ballet School needs to fundraise $12,000 to help cover the cost of airplane tickets, hotel reservations, travel insurance and meals for eleven dancers and the artistic director.

Message From Donita

Hi my name is Donita Nahon, founder and artistic director of Donita Ballet School located in Toronto Ontario Canada. I want to thank you for taking the time to look at this video. We are looking for partners who can help us raise funds to purchase plane tickets and hotel accommodations for eleven dancers who have been invited to perform in Bischheim, France at the 100th Anniversary Gala for the late French composer, Emile Waldteufel. This is a significant professional development opportunity. We will need to raise $12,000 in order to make this happen. I urge you to go to the rewards section to see how you can become a partner in this unique dance experience. I appreciate your consideration and look forward to seeing you at our ballet lessons and performances. Be sure to visit my Facebook, Vimeo and Website to learn more about Donita Ballet School.

story:
The Birches

                                                    by Patty Gliniewicz
                                       Directed by David McCarthy
                                               A Lost Siblings Production 
                                                                   With
  Robbie Mangiardi, Callie Cleaves, Patty Gliniewicz, Matthew Pearson
                                                    Christmas Eve 1989
                                              Just South of Boston

Siblings try to survive their parents chaos each in their own way. Some will survive others won't. What doesn't kill you does not always make you stronger.

                 "Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise". VH

                                        Tickets go on sale October 17th at:

                                  buytickets.at/lostsiblingsproductions


Lost Siblings Productions

LSP was founded in 1999. It was created to give a voice to the working class and those less fortunate. Through film and live theatre LSP helps bring awareness to issues like suicide, depression, substance abuse, domestic violence, and sexual abuse. LSP is a registered 501 (c) nonprofit organization.
  • In 2014 The Birches had its debut. The response was overwhelming.  Those who couldn't get in to the over sold houses kept writing and asking when they'll get a chance to see The Birches.
  • Lost Siblings Productions with your help will return The Birches to the stage this winter.
  • The Lounge Theatre in Hollywood has generously put their stage on hold for the return of The Birches. With your contributions we can bring the play back to life.


We Need Your Help

  • By reaching our goal we'll be able to rent the Theatre; Build the set and dress it; Hire sound & lighting Designers; Get Insured; Rent rehearsal space; make and order the Playbill; and most importantly pay the talent.

Siblings try to survive their parents chaos each in their own way. Some will survive others won't. What doesn't kill you does not always make you stronger.

                 "Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise". VH
                                        Tickets go on sale October 17th at:

                                  buytickets.at/lostsiblingsproductions


Lost Siblings Productions
LSP was founded in 1999. It was created to give a voice to the working class and those less fortunate. Through film and live theatre LSP helps bring awareness to issues like suicide, depression, substance abuse, domestic violence, and sexual abuse. LSP is a registered 501 (c) nonprofit organization.

In 2014 The Birches had its debut. The response was overwhelming.  Those who couldn't get in to the over sold houses kept writing and asking when they'll get a chance to see The Birches. Lost Siblings Productions with your help will return The Birches to the stage this winter.
The Lounge Theatre in Hollywood has generously put their stage on hold for the return of The Birches. With your contributions we can bring the play back to life.  
We Need Your Help
  By reaching our goal we'll be able to rent the Theatre; Build the set and dress it; Hire sound & lighting Designers; Get Insured; Rent rehearsal space; make and order the Playbill; and most importantly pay the talent.

story:
Be a part TAKE Dance's decade of "mesmerizing" contemporary dance with the world premiere of Takehiro Ueyama's THERE AND HERE,  a work exploring the nature of the life after life that will be performed March 26-28, 2015 at the Schimmel Center at Pace University. 

TAKE DANCE will present THERE AND HERE, an evening-length dance work created in celebration of our 10th Anniversary Season. This project represents a new level of ambition for the Company's annual New York City Season, challenging choreographer Takehiro Ueyama to create his second-ever full-evening work, this time on the theme of the process of life and the nature of the afterlife. Joining Ueyama on what will be their first collaborative exploration will be the award-winning musician, composer and producer Hideki Kato, noted Mexican fashion designer César Alcocer and several Special Guest performers who have been associated with TAKE Dance throughout its first successful decade of dance. 

On THERE AND HERE, Take says,

"THERE AND HERE is a work that explores the process of life and the nature of the afterlife.
The body integrates through time with the landscape in a barely perceivable alteration. Through this transition toward the life after life, this metamorphic shifting, the body and the spirit remain as elements of the universe.
As we age, space and time change. The meaning behind our approach shifts as we live and our actions/reactions reflect our life histories.  Memory is stored in the body, thus our body becomes our memories.  Over time, we rely on this memory settled in our bodies.  Life’s beauty becomes the memory chiseled in the body.  As living organisms connected to the ever-evolving universe, we are integrated as a part of the natural environment. We are but stones, whose movements cause the ripple in the water."

The cast of THERE AND HERE includes Associate Director Jill Echo, TAKE Dance alumni Amy Kleinendorst, Orion Duckstein and Nana Tsuda Misko, current company members Brynt Beitman, John Eirch, Kile Hotchkiss, Gina Ianni and Marie Zvosec and Special Guest Miki Orihara.

About TAKE Dance

TAKE Dance is a NYC-based contemporary dance company founded by Artistic Director Takehiro Ueyama. Since 2005, TAKE Dance has been praised for its athletic movement and unusual sensitivity. The Company creates works that deepen society’s understanding of the human condition through the fusion of Eastern and Western perspectives.

The company has performed at Central Park Summer Stage, Baruch Performing Arts Center, Kaatsbaan International Dance Center, the Joyce Theater, Joyce SoHo, New York Live Arts, Symphony Space, Ailey Citigroup Theater, Joe’s Pub at The Public Theater, The Cunningham Studio, Kazuko Hirabayashi Dance Studio, PS/21 Chatham, National Academy Museum, the Miller Theater, Cedar Lake Theater, Judson Memorial Church, Jacob’s Pillow Dance Festival, Sardinia, Festival Internationale Nuova Danza, Sardinia, Italy, WestFest Dance Festival, DanceNOW Festival, Saratoga ArtsFest, West Wave Dance Festival SF, Dance Place, Spring to Dance Festival, New Noises at Perry-Mansfield, Dance St. Louis, the National Cherry Blossom Festival, ArtsQuest Center at SteelStacks, The Lewis Center at Princeton University, Nort Maar Fete de Danse, and the Burgos, Spain International Dance Festival.

takedance.org

About Takehiro Ueyama

Born and raised in Tokyo, Japan, Takehiro “Take” Ueyama moved to New York City in 1991 to attend The Juilliard School. Upon graduation, he joined the Paul Taylor Dance Company, touring the world with them for 8 years. He has also performed with Kazuko Hirabayashi Dance Theatre. His television and film credits include PBS’s Dance in America series (with the Taylor Company), Acts of Ardor, and Dancemaker, a film by dancer/choreographer Matthew Diamond. In 2005, Ueyama founded TAKE Dance.

Ueyama’s work Sakura Sakura was a 2005 prizewinner at the International Modern Dance Choreographic Competition in Spain, and he was selected for the 2006 Free to Rep at FSU’s Maggie Allesee National Center for Choreography. In 2010, he won the S & R Foundation’s prestigious Washington Award.

Ueyama has created and re-staged works for The Juilliard School, Alvin/Fordham, Tallahassee Ballet, The New School, Purchase College, Princeton University, Vassar College, Marymount Manhattan College, Randolph College, Perry-Mansfield Performing Arts School, Booker T. Washington High School for Performing and Visual Arts, the International Summer Dance in Burgos, Spain and ArcDanz in Mexico.

About Hideki Kato

Hideki Kato is a musician, composer & producer who lives in Brooklyn, NYC. His music is often based on narrative elements and topical issues, with a wide range of forms and sounds. His own projects are: Death Ambient with Ikue Mori & Fred Frith; Green Zone with Otomo Yoshihide & Uemura Masahiro; Tremolo of Joy with Charles Burnham, Briggan Krauss, Ed Tomney & Calvin Weston; OMNI wtih Nakamura Toshimaru & Akiyama Tetsuji; Plastic Spoon with Karen Mantler, Douglas Wieselman & Shahzad Ismaily; and the solo works Hope & Despair and Turbulent Zone. As a bassist, he has worked with Eyvind Kang, John King, Karen Mantler, Zeena Parkins, Jim Pugliese, Marc Ribot and John Zorn among many others. Collaborators include Nicolas Collins, James Fei, Christian Marclay & Ursula Scherrer. He co-produced Karen Mantler's Business is Bad for WATT/ECM Records, and music for the Bessie Award-winning THEM with Chris Cochrane.

katohideki.com

story:
Dear Friends,

This project has been close to two years in the making and this fundraising campaign kicks off the first installment of three in this series of performances. I have long been a lover of architecture and, as a dancer, found my "footing" within performance by paying attention to spatial nuances and shifts. As a dear friend once recounted, the first thing I do when entering a room is figure out where I want to be within it. Intersecting my passion for dance's daily practices, the complexities of domestic space, and a very important apartment in Detroit, please explore the details of this project and come for a performance! All performances are FREE and open to the public with RSVP.

Thank you,

Biba


About the Project

“It Never Really Happened” is a dance performance set in the fifth floor corner apartment of a 1958 Mies van der Rohe high-rise in Lafayette Park, Detroit. It offers a singular event for the public to experience dance, domesticity, and modernism's classic architecture. In the fashion of a cocktail party, the two-hour long event opens up a private space to a small audience (15-20 persons), exposing the apartment as a space of intimacy, visibility, and aestheticized leisure. The choreography infiltrates the apartment, combining all attentions in the room to create a shared space of spectacle. Each performance of “It Never Really Happened” is a personalized secret that endures through its audience as a time capsule housed by memory.


photo: Christine Hucal, 2014

Organized as a triptych, the piece is performed at sunset during three seasons (Winter, Summer, Fall), and its three parts transition from a solo to a duet to an ensemble/party. Offering 5-8 performances per installment (15-24 performances total), they are each organized around a different mood, architectural element, time of day, and seasonal color. The dance activates the classic modernism of Van der Rohe’s architecture, highlighting the drama of day-to-day rituals against its panoramic backdrop. Looking out over the backdrop of Detroit's downtown, Eastern Market, and Lafayette Park, the events will give the public a chance to sit back and experience their city from a new perspective, welcomed within the dancer's home. Guests are invited to watch the seasons of the city through a very rare and important window. In a place that can seem so rough and harsh at ground level, slightly elevated - at tree height - there is an overwhelming contact with nature and the nonchalant beauty of the city.


Early rehearsals with dancer Michelle Brock, photo: Biba Bell, 2013


Spearheaded by choreographer and artist Biba Bell, this project brings together a group of Detroit-based collaborators and performers. The music is conceived in collaboration with musician and dj Scott Zacharias. In addition to the series of performance events, a three-channel video of documented footage will be created for future exhibition in collaboration with video artist Christine Hucal. Part One (Solo) is performed by Bell and Part Two (Duet) and Part Three (Ensemble) collaborates with Detroit-based dancers and performers.


A Dance for the Community

“It Never Really Happened” offers the public a new, exciting experience of dance and architecture. Considered an international architectural gem, Lafayette Park is a neighborhood consisting primarily of private residences, which rarely offers public access within its residential spaces. This series of events will open up one of these private spaces to a larger public, giving its audience a chance to experience an evening inside its singular architecture. Inviting guests from within the neighborhood and beyond, the performance will contribute to an existing sense of community while celebrating it with a larger public, connecting the local and city-wide with a regional, national, and international stage.


Early rehearsals with dancer Chris Woolfolk, photo: Biba Bell, 2013


This project is also committed to developing audiences in Detroit for contemporary dance and performance, expanding its reception and exploring the public, social reach of the form. At the same time, it extends a sustainable approach to the continued performance of a dance, where, instead existing within the house of the theater, it invites this audience into its home. The dance can be performed multiple times, night after night, mirroring the daily practice of everyday life that takes place both within and outside our domestic lives.


"It Never Really Happened" was developed during a series of home residencies and a three-hour performance at the Visual Arts Center, University of Texas at Austin, Oct/Nov 2013.


Dispersal of Funds

The monies accumulated in this campaign go towards matching a grant awarded by the Knight Arts Challenge, a community-wide contest supporting ideas that engage and enrich Detroit supported by the John S. and James L. Knight Foundation.
Budget breakdown includes artist and collaborator fees, fees for performers, production costs, post-production and editing fees, technical support, publicity and outreach, and performance materials such as costumes, props, and supplies.

The Knight Foundation supports transformational ideas that promote quality journalism, advance media innovation, engage communities and foster the arts. The foundation believes that democracy thrives when people and communities are informed and engaged.

Project Profile:

http://www.knightfoundation.org/grants/2014998005/

Research for "It Never Really Happened" was additionally supported by the Visual Arts Center at the University of Texas, Austin, and by the Insel Hombroich Foundation in Neuss, Germany. 


Article discussing my personal and artistic process that led me to this project, published in Movement Research Performance Journal, 2014



S A V E  T H E  D A T E !!!

This first installment of performances, Part One (Solo), is scheduled for February 25, 26, 27, 28 and March 7, 8 at 5pm-7pm.

RSVP and Information: https://www.eventbrite.com/myevent?eid=15608196536

T H A N K Y O U !!!!!


photo: Christine Hucal, 2014


"It Never Really Happened" will provide an unprecedented, innovative performance experience for Detroit audiences, who will walk away with a new perspective on the neighborhood and contemporary dance.

http://www.bibabell.com

story:
What is duende?

Exploring the intersection of music and movement, duende's performances connect audiences to the energy of live collaboration. 

Our shows:

  • emphasize an equal collaboration of music and dance, exploring the creative possibilities that result from the marriage of these two disciplines.
  • are held in small customized venues, bringing our audience closer to the art we make.
  • encourage an informal atmosphere, serving art, drinks and conversation.

Our first show!

  • Save the date! Our first shows are happening on March 20 and 21 at the Performance Garage in Philadelphia. 
  • In addition to performances by Duende members Gabriel Cabezas and Chloe Felesina, we will be joined by our amazing friends and collaborators: violinist Emilie-Anne Gendron, violist Nadia Sirota, and dancer Edgar Anido!
  • Music will include works by Daniel Bjarnason, Elliott Carter, Nico Muhly, Steve Reich, Arnold Schoenberg, and a world premiere by Alyssa Weinberg. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our total annual budget is $15,400, and we have already received support from the following granting organizations:  Philadelphia Chapter of the American Composers Forum, the Corzo Center for the Creative Economy at the University of the Arts (Supported by the Knight Foundation), and the Curtis Institute of Music.
  • These funds have covered a variety of start up costs, including building our website and logo, venue rentals, audio and video documentation, and 3 preview events that we produced over the past year. 
  • We still need another $6,000 to put on our full length production in March, which will include fees for the musicians, dancers, a commission for a new composition, choreography, event insurance, staffing, and lighting design.
  • We hope that you will support us and become a part of our community by making this production possible.  In return, perks include free tickets to our show, drink tickets, personalized copies of the new composition, and more!

Our Story 

Our first collaboration took place at World Café Live, presented by Live Connections. After that exhilarating new experience, we knew we couldn't stop and made plans to create our own series.  We want to create performances that connect across mediums and build a community around collaborative art in Philadelphia.

So who are we?

Currently a member of Ballet X, Chloe Felesina makes improvisation and collaboration central to her work, striving to create exuberant, intense, and truthful experiences through dance. As choreographer and co-artistic director of this production, she will bring these varied influences to her work to create movement that is deeply connected to the music and that will draw the audience in for an intimate experience. Cellist Gabriel Cabezas looks to surround himself with artists he admires in any discipline at every opportunity.  Through a variety of different collaborations and interactions, he hopes to create the most natural, honest and transcendent artistry in his music. As performer and co-artistic director, he will work with the composer on musical planning, manage the ensemble of performers, and collaborate with the choreographer on the integration of movement with live performance. Composer Alyssa Weinberg has found collaborations with other artists to be an invigorating, inspiring and driving force in her work, and an element that is essential to her personal development as a musician. As composer in residence and co-artistic director, she will have a central role in curating the musical aspects of the production, writing, arranging and selecting music for our events.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're short on cash these days, not to worry, we still love you! 

  • Help us get the word out! Tell all your friends, share our links and posts, and most importantly come to our show in March! 
  • Get in touch and volunteer at one of our shows!

story:
CONTUS DE JANAS, ovvero racconti di fate

Testo e regia di Carla Stara e Laura Tassi 
Produzione Teatro Ma
in collaborazione con - Jorghe Teatrini Visibili

Con
Mariasofia Alleva  Maria, figlia di Morena
Nastassia Calia  Gilda, borghese mantenuta del Nord Italia
Mattia Pozzi  Riccardo, fidanzato di Maria   
Carla Stara  Morena , l'immigrata sarda 

Davide Bassani  Scenografia
Fabrizio Frisan  Musiche originali e sound design
Mario D'avino Disegno luci


Contu de Janas,ovvero racconti di fate è una drammaturgia originale nata dall'idea e dall'esigenza comune di Carla Stara e Laura Tassi di esplorare il mondo femminile tentando di depurarlo dalle speculazioni, dai qualunquismi e da ogni operazione commerciale che ruota intorno alla parola donna. Il tentativo è di accedere attraverso la storia dei nostri personaggi all'universo femminile, così ambiguo, impenetrabile, sradicato. Dalla leggenda sarda delle Janas, esseri metà fate e metà streghe, piccoli e fragili ma con unghie affilate e poteri magici, emergono differenti archetipi femminili. I nostri personaggi, infatti, sono un po' come le fate sarde: custodiscono tesori preziosi, filano con telai d'oro e proteggono le nuove vite. Accanto al racconto magico delle janas si intrecciano due vicende originali, abitate da personaggi inventati ma con caratteristiche reali: una scena contemporanea in cui due ragazzi, in perenne conflitto sulle scelte del futuro, arrivano a prendere un'importante decisione e una seconda vicenda, narrata tramite dei flash back, in cui si racconta invece dell'incontro tra Gilda, una borghese mantenuta, e Morena, un'ex prostituta emigrata dalla Sardegna al Nord Italia in cerca di fortuna.

Pur non avendo nessuna produzione, abbiamo avviato, da marzo 2013, un processo di ricerca e approfondimento, che necessità continuità, tempo e studio. Da qui la decisione di lanciare un crowdfunding.

Vuoi aiutarci?

Puoi sostenerci!

Teatro MA / JORGHE Teatrini Visibili

Seguici su :  https://www.facebook.com/teatroma?ref=hl

                         www.teatroma.com

         

                                            ////////////////////////////////

Contus de Janas, or fairy tales is an original dramaturgy which was born from Carla Stara and Laura Tassi's need to explore feminity. The authors tried to purify the idea of being a woman from speculation, approximation and any kind of commercialization. The attempt is to explore femininity - which is an ambiguous, cryptic and eradicated concept - through the characters of the play. Female and male archetypes arise from the Sardinian legend of the Janas. The Janas are half fairies and half witches creatures, tiny and delicate but with sharp nails and magic powers. The characters of the play are reminiscent of the Janas: they guard precious treasures, weave with gold spinning wheels and protect newborns. Two stories are intertwined with the fairytale of the Janas. The first story, which is set today, is about a young man and a young woman who have to make a very important decision about the inheritance of an old atelier, in an eternal struggle with future and choices. The second story focuses on the first encounter between Gilda, a bourgeois and kept woman, and Morena, a former prostitute who emigrated from Sardinia to Northern Italy seeking her fortune.

Even without a production, we started in March 2013 a research process which requires continuity, time and study. That is why we have decided to launch a crowdfunding campaign.

Support our project!


Follow us https://www.facebook.com/teatroma?ref=hl

                    https://www.teatroma.com

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Versión en castellano: http://kunstrial.org/cultura-kunstrial/movidito/

Movidito Movidito ist ein Theaterstück, das verschiedene Themen der deutschen und der argentinischen Kultur und Migration zusammenbringt. Es ist eine Arbeit, bei der es darum geht, die Gemeinsamkeiten zweier Kulturen zu untersuchen, mit denen sich die Regisseurin und Dramatikerin María Luisa Stille als Deutsch-Argentinierin identifiziert. Sie hat bisher in Argentinien gelebt und gearbeitet, und ist nach Berlin gekommen um mehr über die Kultur ihrer Eltern zu lernen. Mit Movidito Movidito sollen die Ähnlichkeiten  der Migrationsprozesse in Argentinien (zu Beginn des zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts) und Europa (heutzutage) untersucht werden. 

Fast alle, die an diesem Stück mitarbeiten, haben im Laufe ihres Lebens erfahren, was es heißt, MigrantIn zu sein. Unsere Schauspielerin Tanja Watoro kommt aus Deutschland, hat aber viele Jahre in Bolivien mit dem Teatro de los Andes gearbeitet, die Band Feierabend Poetic Cumbia, besteht aus argentinischen und chilenischen Musikern, die in Berlin leben, unser Komponist Manuel Funes lebt in Argentinien, komponiert die Stücke von dort aus und arbeitet mit uns über Skype zusammen. Unsere Bühnen- und Kostümbildnerin Leonore Lukschy kommt aus Berlin und hat in Argentinien im Teatro María Castaña gearbeitet und für María Luisa Stille, deren Stücke in Lateinamerika mit zahlreichen Preisen ausgezeichnet wurden, ist Movidito Movidito die erste große Regiearbeit in Deutschland. Unterstützt wird das Projekt von KUNSTRIAL e. V. – ein Verein, der seine Arbeit dem kulturellen Austausch zwischen Deutschland und Lateinamerika widmet.

In der argentinischen Provinz Córdoba entstand aus verschiedenen musikalischen Einflüssen der europäischen Einwanderer in der ersten Hälfte des zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts die Cuarteto Musik, die während der Militärdiktatur 1976 - 1983 verboten und 2013 schließlich offiziell als immaterielles Kulturerbe Córdobas anerkannt wurde.

Movidito Movidito erzählt die Geschichte einer Tochter von Immigranten, Eleonora, die als Kind den ersten Cuarteto-Auftritt miterlebt. Sie verliebt sich nicht nur in diesen neuen Rhythmus sondern auch in einen der Musiker und die Liebe zu ihm bestimmt maßgeblich den Verlauf ihres Lebens. Sie wird Zeugin wichtiger Ereignisse, die Córdoba und Argentinien bis zu Beginn der Militärdiktatur 1976 prägen. Die Cuarteto Musik begleitet sie dabei.

Es geht bei dem Projekt vor allem darum, eine neue Sicht auf die argentinische Kultur fernab des Tangos zu schaffen und zu zeigen, wie die Musik und der Tanz Begegnungen zwischen unterschiedlichen Kulturen möglich machen, die bis auf das Land, in dem sie leben, nichts gemeinsam haben. 

Wir arbeiten mit deutschen Texten, die Lieder werden jedoch auf Spanisch gesungen. Der Cuarteto steht historisch für die Kommunikation über Sprachbarrieren hinweg, für die argentinische Arbeiter- und Studentenbewegung und ist heute vor allem ein Rhythmus zum Tanzen und Feiern – das soll auch dem Publikum übermittelt werden. Und so heißt es in dem Stück: Um eine bessere Welt schaffen zu können, muss man sich schließlich auch amüsieren.



Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Um unser Projekt erfolgreich über die Bühne bringen zu können, brauchen wir Mittel um unter anderem einen Probenraum, die Kostüme, das Bühnenbild, unsere Schauspielerin und unsere Musiker zu bezahlen. 

Wir laden Euch dazu ein, Teil dieses Projekts zu werden, in dem die Früchte der kulturellen Vielfalt, die Musik, das Theater, Migrationsprozesse, historische Ereignisse und natürlich die Liebe zu einem unvergesslichen Erlebnis zusammenkommen.

Als Dankeschön bekommt Ihr von uns Poster, exklusives Behind-The-Scenes-Material, den Soundtrack auf CD und habt sogar die Chance bei einer Probe live oder über Skype dabei zu sein!

Die Folgen

Je größer Eure Unterstützung, desto mehr Aufführungen können wir finanzieren, und unser Ensemble angemessen für seine harte Arbeit entlohnen. 
Nachdem KUNSTRIAL e. V. in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Goethe-Institut in Bogotá erfolgreich das Theaterstück Waldemarwolf auf die Bühne gebracht hat und in Berlin die Filmfestivals Invasion Buenos Aires - Berlin und Panorama Colombia unterstützt hat, soll Movidito Movidito das erste von vielen Theaterprojekten in Deutschland sein.

Risiken & Herausforderungen

Es wird für Theaterschaffende immer schwieriger, von ihrer Kunst zu leben, vor allem, wenn sie jung und unbekannt sind. Noch schwieriger ist es, wenn man noch nicht in Deutschland gearbeitet hat. Wir wollen sicherstellen, dass unsere Schauspielerin und unsere Musiker nicht in Versuchungen geraten, das Bühnenbild aufzuessen und die Kostüme bei eBay zu verscherbeln.

Die erste Hürde, ein Theater zu finden, haben wir bereits überwältigt (das wunderbare Hoftheater Kreuzberg), nun gilt es, weitere Aufführungen zu sichern und bei Festivals in Europa, aber durchaus auch in Argentinien und ganz Lateinamerika, aufzutreten. 

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Ihr könnt unser Projekt nicht finanziell unterstützen? Kein Problem! Wir freuen uns auch über weitersagen - teilt unsere Crowdfunding-Kampagne mit Euren Freunden über Facebook, Twitter (#MoviditoBerlin), E-Mail, Skype, SMS, Whatsapp oder mündlich und helft uns so, mehr Menschen zu erreichen! 

Danke! - ¡Gracias!

story:
We've had some donations come in directly to our Fractured Atlas account so we are up to $2,375.99!

UPDATE!

MSP has had the unique opportunity due to unforeseen events to transform Macbeth: The Unsex Me Here Project.


Macbeth: The Unsex Me Here Project

has become

Macbeth: Transformed

2 Women 1 Stage Manager and over 32 guest artists. Each performance will feature 2 new voice over actors and YOU the audience.

We opened April 1st to a wonderfully supportive audience! Get your tickets today and join the adventure!



Summary:

This spring in NYC, Manhattan Shakespeare Project (MSP) welcomes our first ever cross-gender performance: "Macbeth: The Unsex Me Here Project"- a live theatre, fast-paced, high-flying, choose-your-own-adventure production. Every actor is on stage at all times playing multiple roles. There are no boundaries between the stage, the actors, and the audience. Every night a different show, and YOU get to choose the gender!  With YOUR help, we will test our strengths and share the Shakespeare experience in the unconventional venues of Romania’s ‘25 De Ore De Teatru Non Stop’ arts festival.

Born from the need to provide art in a space that socially engages the public and is dedicated to the aesthetic and human, ‘25 De Ore De Teatru Non Stop’ is 25 continuous hours of theater, music, dance, poetry, comedy, jams, conferences, workshops, happenings and gatherings taking place in various locations all over Sibiu, Romania.

Like MSP, the ‘25 De Ore De Teatru Non Stop’ festival brings socially conscience theatre and arts to the community. Now is the time in the development and growth of MSP to perform in  ‘25 De Ore De Teatru Non Stop.’

“We believe theatre can create an empathetic civilization.  We believe theatre can change the world by changing individuals”.

Donate to our cause and help MSP celebrate art with the international masses!

"Macbeth: The Unsex Me Here Project" creates a space where we not only reflect on the world as it is, but where we can actually propose new possibilities for what our society might be.


Your Support Enables Us To:

  • Unite communities and inspire conversations that lead to action and change
  • Broaden community reach through internal growth, workshops, training sessions, and gender based productions
  • Foster collaboration through community engagement, and utilizing theatre as an educational tool
  • Stay abreast of the changing demands of performance, art and education
  • Share ideas and continually strive to learn more about the connections between people and theatre


The Impact

Your contribution will allow the MSP ensemble to travel to Romania, participate in the festival, and return home as stronger artists capable of bridging international cultural gaps.

6 Actors, 1 Stage Manager
7 Flights from NYC to Sibiu - $9100
7 nights Sibiu Hostel - $735
7 days Artist Per Diem - $2450
Total: $12,285

If we cannot reach our goal we certainly cannot travel, but your donation will still help fund 'Unsex Me Here' NYC performances! 

Access Theater performance space - $5025
Rehearsal Space rental - $1264
Artist Fees - $7450
Insurance - $612
Costumes/Set/Props - $600
Archival Videographer - $300
Advertising - $100
Archival Photographer - $100
Total: $15,451

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't donate money, but you can donate time! Please spread the word. 

  • Share our IndieGoGo campaign with your friends and family!
  • Follow us on social media!

Every little bit counts. Thanks for your help! 


Ensemble
Amanda Boekelheide
Sarah Eismann

Production

Director – Amanda Boekelheide
Stage Manager – Rachel A. Jerome
Tech Designer – Antonio Consuegra
Lighting Designer – Samantha Davis
Sound Designer – Jacob Subotnick
Flight Trainer – Michael Mullen
Social Media Guru – Caroline Lyons
Graphic Design – SopArt Studio
Publicity – HellerHighwaterPR


MSP HISTORY

2010 to PRESENT: 4 summers of all-female FREE Shakespeare in the ParkS

2010-Emerging Female Voices Playwrights' Fest

2011-FREE Shakespeare Educational Tour to NYC public schools

2011-New Works Project featuring NYC female playwright

2013-Shakespeare For A New World: The Palestinian Voice, worked w/artists in Palestine & Jerusalem, creating original work using Shakespeare text, song, movement

2014/15-Problem Solving with the Bard: Shakespeare in the Special Education Classroom, yearlong in-school residency

story:
Hi, I'm Sylvia Traymore Morrison and am delighted to be able to share with you our hope to present a stage production of the following taken from the autobiography, "Almost There, Almost...the Many Faces of Sylvia Traymore Morrison.  Please enjoy!

"Sylvia Traymore Morrison, who may be one of America's best kept secrets, is the first African American Female Impressionist in the history of this great nation.  In an effort to tell this epic story funds will be used to secure a stage production of the trials and tribulations of this young Black woman's journey.  

She takes us on an incredible crusade of what it was like for her at a time when Female comics, let alone an impressionist, were almost forbidden. Her legacy in Hollywood is legendary if not well known.  Redd Foxx offered his years of expertise because of the potential she showed.  She walked the streets of Los Angeles and New York City, determined to find her place amongst her peers only to be told "No!" Imagine working with people who had not even made it yet and are now superstars, like Jay Leno, David Letterman, Robin Williams, Jerry Seinfeld.  However, her persistence and passion would not let her settle.

Dick Gregory gave her the job of hosting one of the most incredible Roasts of the century at the legendary Apollo Theater (she actually replaced Richard Pryor) where some of the biggest names in show business roasted the Champ, Muhammad Ali.  As a result of that Roast, Sylvia was offered a job as an associate writer for Saturday Night Live.  Her first assignment at SNL was working with the incomparable Linda Ronstadt.

Whitney Houston, after seeing Sylvia perform, took her on the road with her to 20+ cities in her first epic tour.  Only 2 people performed on that tour.  Sylvia opened.  Whitney closed.  

Sylvia has performed with countless entertainers and is still performing after almost 45 years in this business.  

As an impressionist, she has appeared on stage as Tina Turner, Diana Ross, Dionne Warwick, Cher, Lily Tomlin, Nancy Kulp, Whoopi Goldberg, Mo'Nique, Katherine Hepburn, Joan Rivers, Michelle Obama, Erika Badu, Patti Labelle, Billie Holiday, Etta James, Ella Fitzgerald, Sarah Vaughn, Mahalia Jackson and a host of others...too many to name here.  

The stage play covers, in addition to entertainment, a murder scene, HIV/AIDS and domestic violence.  

Magazine articles and bloggers have suggested that this country may have missed many years of one of the greatest entertainers of our time.  The play will portray just how incredible this story is!"

Please help support this venture!  It will bring lots of encouragement, insight and entertainment to the stage.
story_txt: Hi, I'm Sylvia Traymore Morrison and am delighted to be able to share with you our hope to present a stage production of the following taken from the autobiography, "Almost There, Almost...the Many Faces of Sylvia Traymore Morrison.  Please enjoy!"Sylvia Traymore Morrison, who may be one of America's best kept secrets, is the first African American Female Impressionist in the history of this great nation.  In an effort to tell this epic story funds will be used to secure a stage production of the trials and tribulations of this young Black woman's journey.  She takes us on an incredible crusade of what it was like for her at a time when Female comics, let alone an impressionist, were almost forbidden. Her legacy in Hollywood is legendary if not well known.  Redd Foxx offered his years of expertise because of the potential she showed.  She walked the streets of Los Angeles and New York City, determined to find her place amongst her peers only to be told "No!" Imagine working with people who had not even made it yet and are now superstars, like Jay Leno, David Letterman, Robin Williams, Jerry Seinfeld.  However, her persistence and passion would not let her settle.Dick Gregory gave her the job of hosting one of the most incredible Roasts of the century at the legendary Apollo Theater (she actually replaced Richard Pryor) where some of the biggest names in show business roasted the Champ, Muhammad Ali.  As a result of that Roast, Sylvia was offered a job as an associate writer for Saturday Night Live.  Her first assignment at SNL was working with the incomparable Linda Ronstadt.Whitney Houston, after seeing Sylvia perform, took her on the road with her to 20+ cities in her first epic tour.  Only 2 people performed on that tour.  Sylvia opened.  Whitney closed.  Sylvia has performed with countless entertainers and is still performing after almost 45 years in this business.  As an impressionist, she has appeared on stage as Tina Turner, Diana Ross, Dionne Warwick, Cher, Lily Tomlin, Nancy Kulp, Whoopi Goldberg, Mo'Nique, Katherine Hepburn, Joan Rivers, Michelle Obama, Erika Badu, Patti Labelle, Billie Holiday, Etta James, Ella Fitzgerald, Sarah Vaughn, Mahalia Jackson and a host of others...too many to name here.  The stage play covers, in addition to entertainment, a murder scene, HIV/AIDS and domestic violence.  Magazine articles and bloggers have suggested that this country may have missed many years of one of the greatest entertainers of our time.  The play will portray just how incredible this story is!"Please help support this venture!  It will bring lots of encouragement, insight and entertainment to the stage.

story:
Alicia Graf Mack, former company member of Alvin Ailey American Dance Theatre and co-Founder of D(n)A Arts Collective, has agreed to come to Royal Expressions to choreograph a new work for our upcoming production 31 - a choreography collective to uplift, inspire, and empower women. She will be here July 30 - August 1 and the show will premier on October 3. While here she will also teach master dance classes. We need your help to cover her travel fees, hotel, and artist fee!

Last year, we successfully raised the funds needed to bring Misty Copeland, soloist at American Ballet Theatre, to Greensboro!  We flew her in First Class and purchased new ballet barres to accommodate more dancers in her classes.

With your help, we can ensure that Alicia Graf Mack will receive First Class treatment from us too!

story:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

About the project

Claudine Crosta is the founder of "Anamnèse" project. Inbar Walter joined as co-choreographer. The project includes a community of international artists, decided to strengthen all artistic endeavors they embark on in the future.

As a new immigrant in the country, Claudine felt the urge to offer a vision of what is actually happening in the Israeli Artistic Scene. So many artists coming from so many different places choose to come to Israel in the mood for sharing their memories and passion, in the mood for creating... People need to know what's happening here, people need to connect to this Wonderfull Wave of Endless Inspiration. 

The idea is to be part of this incredible movement: To facilitate and support the collaboration between all the young international artists living in Israel. 

Claudine and Inbar are two professional dancers that met in TLV. After a year performing and touring « Rabia » in Orly Portal Dance Company, they decided to start a research process about the sensation of remembering. To dive deeply into sense-memory, through movements.

We deeply trust that « Anamnèse » is only the first step in what will develop into a full artistic partnership. We all have a big vision about what our group will be tomorrow. 


The team

  • Dancers and creator: Claudine Crosta, Inbar Walter

  • Staging: Claudine Crosta and Gérard Benhamou
  • Literature selection and Writing: Claudine Crosta
  • Actors Direction & Voice Over: Gérard Benhamou
  • Music Creation: Ran Bagno
  • Costumes Designer: Michèle Belin-Benhamou
  • Costumes making: Veronica Szor
  • Lighting: Shachar Werechson
  • Photography, Media & Communication : Fabien Serna-Ostrowsky
  • Video: Moses kaplan




The show "Anamnèse"

"Anamnèse" is a unique visionary show that brings both humor and poetry to the stage.
The show is an invitation to remember. Bringing the audience into the feeling of remembering. Remembering becomes both an intimate and collective journey. A distant voice tells a story. A story, about the intimate relationships we have with our memories. 
This story passes through time, emotion, and experience; focusing on everyday life, and the movement of forgetting.
Throughout the show, the dancers drift from one memory to the next, depicting various worlds, tones, and sensations.
Blending modern dance and contemporary with more whimsical styles, joyfully integrating acting and drumming all together. 
"Anamnèse" is an original and smashing production that will make you groovy!

Time estimation: 60 mins / Première in September 2015


The artistic research

We are investigating the intimate relationship that we do have with memories and time, bringing on stage the scenarios of our lives.

In the first part of the show, we are working on hidden memories. Those memories that are stamped inside of our flesh; they are bound to our essence. Many of us know all too well that memories can also be far from shining doorways to a joyous past. Sometimes we feel the need to escape our memories, or push them away trying to forget what happened, or once was. But what if we decide to face them? Is it a dare?

In the second part of the show we are doing a research on very well know topics such as nostalgia, daily-life and oblivion.   Sometimes memories wash over us like a wave of euphoria. Sometimes they surge through us momentarily overpowering our sensibilities. But it can be to a point that we become confused with what is real and not real. We are re-writting the scenario of our life. We are interested in the movement of repetition. Our daily routines, habits and « addictions » could be a way for us to control the Time. Repeating seems the only way of dealing with being alived. But what if we decide to forget? Forgetting could be the only way to live the moment. The metamorphosis can arise from the repetition… 

The costumes, hanging from the ceiling are the stage set. It’s a metaphore of disembodied memories. All the changing costumes are happening on stage, acting. Dancers are embodying old memories, dealing with them at the present.  

The lighting and music soundtrack are inspired by « Surrealism » ( Artistic way of creating in the 1920’s) . Talking about the border between what is real and what is not, as in dreams. After the Première and all the shows, the audience will be invited to a virtual photo exhibition on our website. A way to invite them to … Remember… 

"Anamnèse" utilizes a unique, collaborative creation process. The core of the process is a specific use of mental imagery, what we call Dynamic Imagery* ( Inspired by The Franklin Method*). Claudine brings ideas that are explored through guided improvisation using words, verbs, poems and prompts. Image, sensation, emotion, posture and balance intertwined; the body and mind constantly affect each other. Each dancer are inspired by personal experience and psychological research and brings thus a unique perspective and a bold kinesthetic movement to "Anamnèse". 

Scenery and framing are also created through images. Claudine envisioned the whole piece as a movie. Beforehand a script is made, then it’s tried out in the studio with the whole group and evolves this way.


Your donation

Your donation will not only directly help the Production Costs but will also allow us to continue our Story as a Group. This first foot in the door is a wonderful opportunity for us and we want share it with all of you. 

  • Theater Rental for the Première
  • Rehearsal Spaces
  • Lighting Design
  • Set Design Supplies
  • Original Music Composition
  • Actors Direction 
  • Voice-Over
  • Costume Design and making
  • Photos, videos and medias
  • Marketing fees


The challenging part

This production has been in development for about 5 months.  Our team has been set, but having been funded only through personal income, our Production and Story cannot continue further without funds raised through you and Indiegogo. 

We are so excited to work together and so create a community of international artists. We are so excited to bring this production to light... We feel Happy to be so inspired and ready to make our dream come true.  But In order to fully realize "Anamnèse" potential , we need your help. Any donation you can offer. No matter how big or small. Will go very long way...

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

Follow us on our website : http://anamnese.website

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 Anamnèse*

Un spectacle inédit haut en couleur par un groupe d’artistes internationaux

 

A propos

Claudine Crosta est à l’initiative du projet « Anamnèse ». 

En tant que nouvelle immigrante, Claudine souhaite faire découvrir l’énergie créatrice qui existe aujourd’hui en Israël. Tel Aviv est le berceau d’une communauté d’artistes internationaux, talentueux et ambitieux prêts à créer ensemble avec leur diversité. 

Pour cette première pièce écrite, confectionnée, réalisée et jouée en avant-première en Israël, Claudine travaille en collaboration avec Inbar Walter qui a rejoint ce projet en tant qu’interprète et chorégraphe associée. 

« Anamnèse » regroupe un collectif d’artistes internationaux, de différentes nationalités et générations, tous animés par le  même désir de faire de cette pièce le début d’une longue collaboration artistique. Inscrire le début d’une histoire, s’apprendre et créer un langage commun.


L’équipe

  • Créateurs et Danseurs: Claudine Crosta, Inbar Walter
  • Selection littéraire et écriture : Claudine Crosta
  • Mise en scène: Claudine Crosta et Gérard Benhamou
  • Direction & Voix off : Gérard Benhamou
  • Création musicale originale : Ran Bagno
  • Costumes Designer : Michelle Belin-Benhamou
  • Confection Costumes: Veronica Szor
  • Création Lumières : Shachar Werechson
  • Photographie, Communication & Medias: Fabien Serna Ostrowsky
  • Videos : Moses kaplan



Le spectacle

Deux danseuses nous entraînent dans un tourbillon visuel inédit. Tantôt poétique, tantôt plein d’humour « Anamnèse » est avant tout un spectacle surprenant. 

En 6 tableaux,  nous voyageons au rythme d’une voix lointaine qui nous emmène aux confins des souvenirs. Une voix qui parlent de façon intime de traces de vie, d’empreintes, de quotidien, d’oubli.

Chaque tableau est une surprise haute en couleur, où les interprètes nous transportent dans leur univers fantasque et théâtral.

« Anamnèse » est une ode aux arts du spectacle. L’occasion de faire se côtoyer les percussions, le théâtre et la danse dans tous ses états. Du ballet à la danse contemporaine en passant par les danses latines, folkloriques et moderne, on savoure autant le groove des artistes que leur qualité technique.

Un pur moment de divertissement 

Estimation durée: 60 mins / Première prévue en Septembre 2015



La démarche artistique

Claudine et Inbar se sont rencontrées à Tel Aviv en 2014 alors danseuses pour Orly Portal Dance Company.

Au rythme des tournées, elles ont pris le temps de se raconter leur histoire, d’évoquer leurs souvenirs. 

Deux femmes tellement différentes qui aujourd’hui vivent sur une même Terre… Claudine, née à Marseille et Inbar à Ein Gedi … Et pourtant tellement semblables.

L’envie de créer ensemble, d’explorer le sujet de la mémoire ou plus précisément des mémoires est née comme une evidence. 

Le thème de la mémoire

La recherche d’Anamnèse repose sur la relation intime que l’on entretient avec nos souvenirs et avec le temps.

Dans la première partie du spectacle, on considère que les souvenirs façonnent le corps et l'être à part entière. On associe les souvenirs à des empreintes indélébiles qui font ce que nous sommes. On s’intéresse au mouvement explosif, intrusif de ces mémoires. Elles apparaissent sans prévenir, elles se révèlent brutalement. Il est question de mémoires dites pré-natale ou infantiles. 

Dans la seconde partie du spectacle, on aborde des thèmes très connus: La nostalgie, le quotidien et l’oubli. On y explore plus précisément notre relation au temps.

Il est alors question de mouvement volontaire. Quand on part à la cueillette de souvenirs sur fond de nostalgie ou encore lorsque l’on se met en « pilotage automatique » répétant sans cesse ces habitudes tellement humaines que nous choyons tous.

Enfin, on considère que de la répétition naît la mutation. Et si l’oubli de l’anamnèse, était l’unique moyen de danser sa vie ? 

Le procédé de création chorégraphique en studio

Anamnèse utilise un procédé unique de création et l’imagerie mentale* en est le pilier ( Inspirée de La Méthode Franklin*). 

Les idées sont explorées lors de séances d’improvisation guidées. A partir d’une recherche de mots, de verbe ou de textes, Claudine propose un travail autour des sensations qu’ils éveillent. 

La question est de chercher à écouter la sensation que l’imagination fait naître et vice-versa. S‘établit alors un dialogue constant entre la pensée et la sensation corporelle. Tout est intrinsèquement lié : L’imaginaire, l’émotion, la posture et l’équilibre. 

Chacune des danseuse apporte une perspective unique, s’inspirant de son expérience personnelle, de ses propres inspirations et de son approche kinesthésique. 

Mise en scène et autre plaisir

La mise en scène a été imaginée puis écrite par Claudine comme un script de film.  Elle est ensuite façonnée en studio par l’ensemble de l’équipe. 

Anamnèse se construit et évolue ainsi comme une histoire avec l’ensemble du groupe. 

Les costumes sont non seulement un plaisir visuel permettant l’illusion mais sont aussi les pièces maîtresses du décor. Ils sont une métaphore de mémoires désincarnées.

Les créations originales, musique et lumière sont inspirées du Surréalisme. Il s’agit de jouer avec les frontières entre le réel et l’affabulé, comme dans un rêve.

Enfin, les spectateurs sont invités après le spectacle à une exposition virtuelle de photos sur le site internet du projet. L’idée étant de prolonger leur souvenir, leur expérience…



Votre contribution

Nous sommes tellement enthousiastes à l’idée de donner vie à cette pièce. Nous travaillons à sa réalisation avec passion et détermination.

Votre soutien nous est précieux. 

En participant au financement de cette production, vous nous permettez d’exprimer pleinement notre talent et de dévoiler ainsi le fabuleux potentiel de ce spectacle.

Vos dons permettront non seulement de financer la production mais aussi d’écrire la première page de notre histoire. 

  • Location du Théâtre pour la Première
  • Locations de studios pour processus de création
  • Design Lumière
  • Décors
  • Création Musique originale
  • Mise en scène
  • Design costumes
  • Photos, videos
  • Communication, médias, marketing


Challenge

Anamnèse est un projet ambitieux qui a commencé il y a 5 mois. Aujourd’hui, l’auto-financement met en danger le bon déroulement du processus de création. Des fonds doivent être investis afin de permettre à notre groupe de poursuivre ce processus à la hauteur de notre ambition. 

L’ensemble de notre groupe vous remercie chaleureusement pour votre soutien et votre contribution.

Suivez-nous sur notre site internet : http://anamnese.website

*Du grec, anamnêsis, action de rappeler à la mémoire (utilisé en médecine et liturgie)

Les idées sont explorées lors de séances d’improvisation guidées. A partir d’une recherche de mots, de verbe ou de textes, Claudine propose un travail autour des sensations qu’ils éveillent. 
La question est de chercher à écouter la sensation que l’imagination fait naître et vice-versa. S‘établit alors un dialogue constant entre la pensée et la sensation corporelle. Tout est intrinsèquement lié : L’imaginaire, l’émotion, la posture et l’équilibre. 
Chacune des danseuse apporte une perspective unique, s’inspirant de son expérience personnelle, de ses propres inspirations et de son approche kinesthésique. 
Mise en scène et autre plaisir
La mise en scène a été imaginée puis écrite par Claudine comme un script de film.  Elle est ensuite façonnée en studio par l’ensemble de l’équipe. 
Anamnèse se construit et évolue ainsi comme une histoire avec l’ensemble du groupe. 
Les costumes sont non seulement un plaisir visuel permettant l’illusion mais sont aussi les pièces maîtresses du décor. Ils sont une métaphore de mémoires désincarnées.
Les créations originales, musique et lumière sont inspirées du Surréalisme. Il s’agit de jouer avec les frontières entre le réel et l’affabulé, comme dans un rêve.
Enfin, les spectateurs sont invités après le spectacle à une exposition virtuelle de photos sur le site internet du projet. L’idée étant de prolonger leur souvenir, leur expérience…


Votre contributionNous sommes tellement enthousiastes à l’idée de donner vie à cette pièce. Nous travaillons à sa réalisation avec passion et détermination.
Votre soutien nous est précieux. 
En participant au financement de cette production, vous nous permettez d’exprimer pleinement notre talent et de dévoiler ainsi le fabuleux potentiel de ce spectacle.
Vos dons permettront non seulement de financer la production mais aussi d’écrire la première page de notre histoire. 


Location du Théâtre pour la Première


Locations de studios pour processus de création


Design Lumière


Décors


Création Musique originale


Mise en scène


Design costumes


Photos, videos


Communication, médias, marketing





Challenge
Anamnèse est un projet ambitieux qui a commencé il y a 5 mois. Aujourd’hui, l’auto-financement met en danger le bon déroulement du processus de création. Des fonds doivent être investis afin de permettre à notre groupe de poursuivre ce processus à la hauteur de notre ambition. 
L’ensemble de notre groupe vous remercie chaleureusement pour votre soutien et votre contribution.Suivez-nous sur notre site internet : http://anamnese.website
*Du grec, anamnêsis, action de rappeler à la mémoire (utilisé en médecine et liturgie)

story:
SYNOPSIS

A Priceless Heart is a story about finding true love and going the distance to keep it. It's a journey of self-discovery and a tale which illustrates in more ways than one the power of great love. In the musical, Lauren Carter, a 20 year old college undergraduate, is torn between her father's plans for her and her own plans for herself. As heiress of her father's billion dollar corporation, everything in Lauren's life is designed to help her successfully take over from him. But Lauren wants nothing more than to chase her own dreams-to be a musician. Yet, she lives by her father's every rule until she learns of his plans to exploit her. In a fit of anger, she leaves the house and embarks on her journey of self-discovery. In the process, she gets to know Ife Jacobs, the Nigerian-American bartender at her family's favorite bar. A mutual attraction ensues and a relationship begins. But they are two worlds apart. He's from the meagerly hoods of the Marcy Projects and she's from the wealthy Upper East side of New York. Besides, with her father in the middle, Lauren knows dating Ife would not be a walk in the park. In the end, Lauren is forced to make a decision between her father's empire and the love of her life.

A Priceless Heart is a tale of grace, healing, restoration and the power of true love. It's a story that'll take the audience on an unexpected journey filled with warmth and inspiration.


ABOUT THE PLAYWRIGHT

Lysious Ogolo is a graduate of Radio, TV and Film from Howard University. A novelist, playwright, screenwriter, actor,director and producer, he has written, produced, and directed a series of plays and musicals, including, The Case Against Christmas and Anything Good among others. He currently serves as the Head of Department of FACES, a drama ministry associated with Jesus House, DC, a mission of the Redeemed Christian Church of God. 

                                                                        

Originally a Nigerian, Lysious currently resides in Maryland. He hopes to tell stories which inspire hope and love in the hearts of his audience, while leaving them entertained and enlightened. In a world filled with many uncertainties and heartaches, Lysious desires to craft stories that will encourage, inspire, challenge, and warm the hearts of people; stories that reflect the reality of society with a promise of hope even in the most dire of circumstances, and stories that portray rich, positive and balanced images of Black people.


WHY THIS PROJECT IS IMPORTANT
In the world we live in today, many people continue to struggle with suppressed dreams which they cannot chase for fear of failure. They also struggle with painful pasts which keep them from fully chasing their dreams, whether such pasts are of abuse or failure. I'm one of such people and that makes this project very personal to me. The essence of this story is to bring encouragement to those who find themselves bound either by their past or present circumstances. It is about inspiring young people everywhere to chase their dreams even in the face of obstacles. Funding this project will not only help me fulfill my dream of seeing this come to pass, it will also help me tell a story which I'm sure will inspire hope in the lives of many young people. 


WHY DONATE?

Because this is a musical, the funds raised will help us pay for the producers, musicians, and choreographers who will be working on the music and dance. It will also go towards paying the actors decently. Feeding, theater rentals, costume, and props are some of the other logistics the funds will help cover. Studio time and a great soundtrack will also be included in our final tally. 

By helping us meet and exceed our goal, you'll be helping us produce a magnificent musical while helping us tell a story that will leave audiences inspired and encouraged.  You would also be helping bring ethnically diverse and inspirational stories to the stage, while helping Lysious launch his career as a playwright and film maker.

story:
Hello everyone, 

As some of you may know the The Savage Detectives Theater Company was formed just over a year ago, in New York City. In that time we have put on two outstanding plays, Mercury Fur by Phillip Ridley and our sold out run of The Last Days Of Judas Iscariot by Steven Adley Guirguis. The response of the audience and critics alike were so positive that we want to keep exploring and stretching the boundries of our creativity. 

The Savage Detectives Theatre Company thrives on telling multi-cultural narratives with actors from diverse and varied backgrounds. As America was built by many different people from all over the world, so too was our collective. We strive to tell contemporary stories that are emblematic of this spirit. We also encourage actors to play multiple roles in the production beyond just their onstage involvement, when the setting is fit for it. Our composers play music live during our show, because we want audiences to witness our collaborative spirit firsthand. Together, we make not just acting choices, but the entirety of the theater experience possible for an audience.

For our next season we have come up with the idea of doing three plays. Two by stablished playwrights and one original work by one of our members. The plays are Killer Joe by Tracy Letts (wrights have been submitted), Punk Rock by Simon Stephens(wrights have been submitted) and "Untitled Play", original work by Xavier Galva.  Our first production will be Killer Joe, in early June of this year. Followed by Punk Rock in October and then the original work at the beginning of 2016. In order to see our goals become a reality, we do need your help again. We hope to raise $12,000

Your contributions will not only help us make these production a reality but it will also give 21 actors and three directors the chance to show their outstanding skills in the theatre capital of the world. The ticket sales for Killer Joe and Punk Rock will also go towards the funding of Galva's play.

We hope you will support us by donating and helping us grow as a company and also to develop our art. Thank you and love to everyone. 

The $12000 dollars raised will allow us to:

.Book 3  Off-Broadway or Off Off- Broadway theatres  $7000

.Pay for the rights to the play $960

.Props and set $2000

.Rehearsal space $1000

.Promotion $1040 

If our ultimate goal is not met, the money received will still go towards the plays and everything will go ahead but on a smaller scale.

This production hopes to inspire more people to go out there and produce their own work. When people hear the word Broadway they automatically think "expensive"; we want to show that this is not the case and that with a minimal amount of money you can put on a great pieces of theatre. Your contributions will help show that through hard work and dedication you can make your dreams and ambitions a reality. 

We totally understand that because of these financial times not everyone can contribute  but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

If you could please spread the word about this play and campaign. If you could send this link to any of your friends or relatives that you think would be interested or could help, that would be amazing.

Thank you so much for your time and contributions.

story:
Short Summary

My name is James Blount and I am apart of Properly Produced Productions. I am here today to help gain some support for our premier show, Head: A Symphony of Horror! to be staged at The Tenth Avenue Arts Center for their thrilling yet chilling event, Terror at The Tenth from October 19th through November 8th! A contribution to this cause will help us get our first show up off the ground and provide a solid foundation for us as a new theatre company and will allows us to continue with new projects in the future!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $5,000 dollars to get us started and here's what we need to put the funding towards: 

Theatre rental, costumes, make-up, set, and special effects such as stage blood and a video projector. 

Our Perks are out of this world! 

We are offering a wide variety of options to donate and the rewards are outstanding! Everything from receiving tickets to the show to feeling like Theatre VIP by being invited to our Opening Night Celebration! By donating at our $30 Tier you will be receiving a ticket to the show at half price of what they will cost when they go on sale to the public! (That's two tickets for the price of one full price ticket!) Hurry, because that is an amazing deal! We also have several other amazing deals available, including a special behind the scenes tour of the show to see just "how did we do that" during the show! We even have an invite to our cast party at the end of the opening night at The Top of The Tenth! 

The funds will still be applied in the areas mentioned even if we do not reach our funding goal. Anything you can offer is greatly appreciated!  

We will contact you when the time comes closer to our performances and reserve your seats for the show! Donate as soon as you can because we will reach out to you in the order you reserved your tickets to the show! 

We will be performing at Terror At The Tenth at The fabulous Tenth Avenue Arts Center from October 19th through November 8th, 2015! 

The Impact

By helping us establish our Troope with this Premiere show, you will be helping us in our mission statement which is: 

"Properly Produced Productions’ mission is to bring a new understanding of ourselves and others through the creative outlet of live theatre. We want to encourage, stimulate and celebrate others creativity by producing new works, helping others develop new shows and taking well known shows and giving it our own vision and heart. We want to create a great creative bond between all artists in the community."

Risks & Challenges

Theatre is a risky business and consistently changing as it is a living thing a creative conglomeration of talent together to create wickedly awesome art. Being in the field for just over 18 years I have had several successful productions and several learning opportunities to help guide me where I am today. I have managed and directed theatre groups in that past and established a theatre group in a charter school. Some Producing credits include; Broadway in My Backyard: Broadway Under The Stars and Cinderella a Twisted Drag Fairy tale.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Please also use the Indiegogo share tools!

Interested in becoming a part of our street team or volunteer for one of our shows? Wonderful! Click this link here http://bit.ly/1BmYO96  to get started! 
We thank you for your time and support!
