story:
Short Summary

About the Musical:

A college student discovers that her father is accused of rape through a viral tweet.

A successful accountant struggles to justify her queer relationship in a conversation with a conservative parent.

A new father vows to change the world for his infant daughter.

In "My Father, Too", three one-act musicals explore the nuances of father-daughter relationships in the #MeToo era.

About the Composer/Lyricist:

Celina Reynes is a composer, lyricist, and teacher based out of Oakland, CA. Her lyrical work focuses on the nuances of identity and sexuality, memory, and reputation. Her lyrics are sometimes humorous, sometimes romantic, sometimes macabre; she enjoys exploring the tension between what audiences expect from a character and who the character really is.

Musically, Celina draws inspiration from sources as eclectic as folk storytellers (Mitchell, Dylan), contemporary musical theatre artists (Sondheim, Jason Robert Brown) and, in some cases, early modern music compositions (e.g., Byzantine chants, medieval court music). She believes that her perspective as a queer, female storyteller compels her to promote stories that continue to be underrepresented in musical theatre.

Celina is excited for the Hollywood Fringe Festival, where she will be showcasing work with a more contemporary feel than she has produced in previous performances. 

"My Father, Too" will be workshopped at The Marsh Theatre in San Francisco before its premier at HFF. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need help with the following:

  • The New American Theatre (Rental Space, five performances) - $825
  • Hollywood Fringe Registration Fee - $300
  • Stage Management and Tech - $200
  • Piano and Projector rental - $100
  • Transportation to LA - $35 x 2 = two tanks of gas

REVISED BUDGET AS OF 03/03/2020:

  • The Actor's Company (Rental space, five performances) - $575 
  • ✅ Hollywood Fringe Registration Fee - $300 
  • ✅Stage Management and Tech - $200
  • ✅Piano and Projector rental - $100
  • Transportation to LA - $35 x 2 = two tanks of gas

Total: $1,245*

*Unable to change the fundraising goal on indiegogo; if we exceed this amount, the remaining funds will go toward paying actors, promotional materials, professional accompaniment, and other production-enhancing resources! 

AVAILABLE PERKS:

  • Handwritten thank you notes
  • Special "Thanks" in the program
  • Advertising space in the program
  • A signed poster of the show
  • Signed original score and/or signed script
  • A dinner at Belotti in Rockridge, Oakland with the composer and arranger

The Impact

By participating in this campaign, you have the chance to promote local, independent theatre; support a musical that advocates for gender equality; join a growing community of theatre artists and patrons. Your contribution makes a difference, whether big or small, to the success of this project!

Risks & Challenges

With a house size of 35, and a five-night performance package, the best-case scenario is that we sell 175 tickets. In order to keep the show accessible to all, we are offering a sliding scale of $5 to $25 tickets. This means that, if we average $10 a ticket and sell out the house, our show revenue would be $1750.

In that best-case scenario, our profits would be distributed among our volunteer actors and crew members as travel-stipends and as honorariums, and/or used to record a professional demo of the music. 

As you can see, this will not be a money-making venture! Our hope is that Hollywood Fringe allows us to tell a powerful story and make connections with people who we may not otherwise meet during our day jobs. We are putting on this production for the love of theatre, not for any financial gain. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you choose to donate, you can support this production by...

  • Sharing our campaign on your social-media platforms
  • Offering to volunteer your skills (marketing, editing) during the development and production of our musical
  • Sending us brief notes of support and solidarity

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts!
story_txt:
Short Summary
About the Musical:
A college student discovers that her father is accused of rape through a viral tweet.
A successful accountant struggles to justify her queer relationship in a conversation with a conservative parent.
A new father vows to change the world for his infant daughter.
In "My Father, Too", three one-act musicals explore the nuances of father-daughter relationships in the #MeToo era.
About the Composer/Lyricist:
Celina Reynes is a composer, lyricist, and teacher based out of Oakland, CA. Her lyrical work focuses on the nuances of identity and sexuality, memory, and reputation. story:
Greg Owens

Manager/Producer

Astrology Productions LLC

713-299-0726

astrologyproductions@outlook.com

 

                  A Timeless Story of Christmas - Holiday Show

 

Astrology Productions kindly invites your support for an entertainment event coming this 2019 Holiday Season from November until the end of December and striving for continued success for many more holiday seasons. 

A Broadway production musical and dance will consist of piano keyboards, drummer and guitarist with a mid-size orchestra.  The dance scene will consist of a manger scene then a village scene with 30 dancers in the show and an intermission of holiday fun.

  • Broadway Productions: Seating of theatres/venues – 500-4500+; Budget $2,000,000-$9,000,000 (National – California, Colorado, Washington, Nevada, Washington, New York, Illinois, Pennsylvania, Missouri, Georgia and Florida.
  • Off-Broadway Production: Seating of theatres/venues – 200-500; Budget $500,000-$2,000,000 (Regional – Kansas, Missouri, Nevada or West Coast and maybe Texas)
  • Off-Off Broadway Production: Seating of theatres/venues 50-200: Budget $25,000 - $500,000 (Kansas, Missouri and Texas)

 (There will be show(s) it depends on the amount of funding) – meaning there will be Off-off Broadway shows if the minimum amount is received.

* UNIQUE PERKS:  

$50 donation - Musical CD or drinking bottle (with Magi and The Messiah printed on bottle or if there is a sponsor then the company sponsor logo printed also)

$100 donation - Musical CD and drinking bottle.

$500 donation – Musical CD, drinking bottle and listed on social media or website if you choose of donation made.

$1000 donation – Musical CD, drinking bottleand listed on social media or website if you choose of donation made. (if Broadway show and sponsor then VIP guest benefits)

$5000+ donation – 1 complimentary ticket (if Off-Broadway or Broadway show), musical CD, drinking bottle. (if Broadway show and sponsor then VIP guest benefits) and advertising of your choice either on social media, in print or website.

Note:

  • Working on securing a distributor to make into an animated movie which would not come out until 2021 or 2022) – if so then $100 donation would receive (1) movie ticket; $500 donation (2) movie tickets; $1000 donation (3) movie ticket; $5000+ donation (4) movie tickets. \
  • The CD is in the production budget itemized under music; the bottle would be itemized under marketing/advertising; advertising itemized under marketing/advertising.
  • You can opt out on any perks and they are negotiable if you donate $500 or more.

The show production will help promote the movie (none of the money for this production will be used for this movie; if a distributor deal is secured then the distributor will guarantee the loan on the film). If there is a movie then it will help promote the show in the future.

BIOS:

Greg Owens is the Manager and Producer for the show The Magi and the Messiah for the coming 2019 holiday season.   He has also, written a treatment for The Magi and the Messiah and Babe Ruth to be adapted into a screenplay for an animated movie where it is planned for Astrology Productions to act as the production company for the animated film.  A songwriter, pianist and producer who has worked with songwriting and producing songs for artists and groups for “Mutt” Lange, Desmond Child and Max Martin to name a few great producers in the music business.  Also, Greg Owens is working on a book - All-Time NFL Greatest Rivalries Resolved by a Statistical Point System planned to be completed on or before November 15, 2019. 

Show Description:

A spectacular event encompassing musical and dance in the timeless story of the Magi and the birth of Christ where King Herod is determined to harm the child in fear of his kingdom. The show will bring an abundance of spine thrilling action with angels to the rescue and a deep joy but concern among the villagers and shepherds that run into a showdown of wits with King Herod and his soldiers.

An intermission not to miss that will cultivate what has become the traditional Christmas spirit with some enlightened fun and dance. 

 

www.astrologyproductions.com

astrologyproductions@outlook.com

https://www.linkedin.com/in/greg-owens-8829a9186/

https://www.instagram.com/astrologyproductions/

https://twitter.com/AstrologyProdu1

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E702ezTb-eA

 

Tis is the season, a time to bring people and families together so bring your entire family have some refreshments and enjoy the show.  This is a unique and sustainable vision which supports the spirit of Christmas.

story:
Short Summary

As a child, dance was always more than just entertainment. It was a language, one with which my peers could relate with. Growing up, i was sure it was the path i wanted to take. Dancing is my passion and I seek to share it with the  world. It is my escape to a space of nothingness and endless possibilities, giving room to explore deep expressions without restrictions and/or expectations. It allows the process of becoming and feeling.

I started going for training and workshops that helped me with background and basic knowledge, of which personal research and consistent training helped me to improve. I have dedicated the last decade of my life to sharing my passion with others through my work at The Krump Dance Studios in Abuja where I have been fortunate enough to both teach and choreograph people interested in dancing (children, hobbyists and professionals) and as a freelancer, performing for audiences.

One major problem in the dance industry is that dance education isn't as popular  as other forms of art training in Nigeria. This makes the Ecoles Des Sables diploma program very important to me. I am committed to learning and achieving the most excellent standards of dance and sharing my knowledge to inform and educate dancers in Nigeria, as well as always looking for an avenue to improve.

The diploma program will help me explore my choreographic skills. Already, I have had the opportunity of being part of projects by dance teachers from in and out of the country such as Qudus Onikeku, Onye Ozuzu, Horacio Macuacua, Jemima Angulu, as well as a host of few others.

My experience in choreography, training, workshops, among others, reassured me that the opportunity to participate in the Diploma In Traditional and Contemporary Dances Of Africa will highlight my performance creativity and my eagerness to always be involved in innovative learning processes. Training is the foundation for the life and work of a dancer and artist.

With no dance education, I started my journey. I look forward to sharing my knowledge with others who are starting out their journey in dance and helping those who are already on the journey with me.

Help me actualise my dream of dance practice and creation.

Right now, I'm sourcing for funds for my ticket as well as some welfare money to cover my stay there. My inscription (tuition) fees of 270,000 FCFA has already been covered by a reputable institution, all that is left is my ticket fee to Senegal.

The Ecole Des Sables' Diploma in Traditional Contemporary Dance of Africa is an opportunity for me to enhance and further my training as both a teacher and a professional. The diploma program is in three-month long modules, one each year for three consecutive years in Toubab Dialaw, Senegal and I was delighted to have been accepted. All I need now is a return-ticket to and fro Senegal and some welfare money.

The total amount I'm seeking for is 1530 USD which is roughly the equivalent of N560,000 for my ticket towards my first year at the project. Anything left will be saved towards my upkeep while there.

I'm also searching for other resources to cover for my flight. If i get more than is needed for the project this year, I'd save up the remaining as part of my tuition and ticket for the next year.

story:
About American Carnage...

American Carnage is a new play by Ché Walker, written in response to the inauguration and first 100 days of the presidency of Donald Trump.  American Carnage is a surrealist fable about America, politics, the power of anger and the choices we make to survive.  Clare Latham and Meghan Cox play Erica, a woman who's choice to survive a brutal kidnapping has led her to cleave herself in two.

After a successful first reading at Horizon Theatre Company in Atlanta, GA (as a companion piece to Walker's The Ballad of Klook and Vinette), we are holding a reading in New York, generously hosted by our friends at New York Theatre Workshop, in the hopes of finding partners to help us deliver a full production in 2019.

Why We Need You!

At this stage, we need the support of our friends in two ways:

  • First, we are seeking to raise an initial amount of $1,500 to pay our cast and creative team for their work on this reading, as well as cover our initial rehearsal costs.  Anything you can give towards supporting these two incredible artists would be hugely appreciated.
  • Secondly, and just as importantly, if you want to play a part in driving this incredible piece of theater forward, we want to hear from you.  We are currently looking for producing partners who would help us deliver a world premiere of American Carnage in 2019, and if you know anyone who might be interested (or you are anyone who might be interested!), please get in touch so we can welcome you to the reading.

The Reading

A full, staged reading of American Carnage will take place at New York Theatre Workshop's 4th Street Theatre, on Wednesday, 14th November at 7pm.  The reading is free of charge, and is by invitation only for our supporters and potential partners.  We'd be so thrilled to have you join us to hear the play, if you are interested in attending, please email alexguiney@gmail.com with the number of tickets you require, and any questions you have that we can answer for you.

Thank you for your support, we can't wait to see you!

Team AC

campaign_city: New York Theatre Workshop, United States

story:
Short Summary

My name is Bridget Mundy and I'm a playwright residing in NYC. I've been living there going on 3 years now, and this is my first large scale professional production in the city (I'm very very excited.) Directing is David Charles, 

My mentality is "support those who have supported you." This cast and crew is making a dream of mine a reality, so I want to repay them by giving them the best experience I can. That's where you come in. 

  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Through this funding we can:

-pay cast and crew a sufficient rate (the most important thing to me)

-Have more options regarding set, costume, and overall production design to ensure the best possible performance for the United Solo Festival

What We Need & What You Get

Following the "support" mentality mentioned above, here's some little gifts to give back to you as thanks:

$5 gets you: 

A message of thanks!

$10 gets you:

a message of thanks and a hi-five/hug!

$20 gets you:

A voicemail from me singing your praises (literally singing!)

$50 gets you:

All of the above and a mention in the program insert! (How cool!)

$100 gets you:

Wow, you must really love us. You get a digital copy of the script! And I'll draw you a picture! (AND you get your name in the program insert!)

$500 gets you:

Woah okay wow. $500? Thank you. I can't believe you would do this for us. Here's what we'll do: You get the title of co-producer in the program insert! And a digital script! And a drawing from me! And everything else! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tickets for the show are being sold here: http://unitedsolo.org/us/2019-awarehouseinroche... 

Please spread the word where ya can! We appreciate any form of help :)

UNITED SOLO THEATRE FESTIVAL is an annual international festival for solo performances held at the Theatre Row in the heart of the New York City theatre district on 42nd Street, currently in its 10th anniversary season. Fiona Shaw called United Solo “the mecca of the solo shows in the world.” Over 120 participants from six continents will present their shows every day from September 19 until November 24, 2019.

Through its mission, United Solo presents renowned artists as well as new talents, discovers original stories, connects artists with their audiences, exchanges diverse perspectives, fosters a dialogue for change, entertains, and now also educates through its professional training program led by distinguished artists and cultural icons. Artists and companies interested in being presented at The United Solo Festival in 2020 are now welcome to submit their applications online at www.unitedsolo.org starting September.

story:
Bolero - A Journey Celebrating Creativity, was created to celebrate the 30th anniversary of the White Cloud Studio of New York, the world's first center of the GYROTONIC® Method.  Juliu Horvath choreographs protagonists Elisabetta Carnevale, Prima Ballerina of the White Cloud Opera in Rome, and Jackson Kellogg.

Bolero is inspired by texts written by the same Juliu Horvath: a journey into his own "self",” retracing the Master and Choreographer’s personal artistic path.

The choreography was born from the desire to celebrate both the "Creativity of Being" and the creative force of the Universe.  The show is composed of three interconnected sections, each following the choreography of Horvath and other interpreters.

The GYROTONIC® Method will serve as active element of the performance, with GYROKINESIS® sequences designed as tools to express the harmony of the dance. American and European dancers will join the Italian team, united by the common experience of the GYROTONIC® Method.

Any kind of contribution is highly appreciated and represents a fundamental step towards our funding goal. Share this adventure with us, and share it with your friends and on social media!

A big thank you, 

The White Cloud Opera Team

GYROTONIC® and GYROKINESIS® are registered trademarks of Gyrotonic Sales Corp and are used with their permission.
story_txt:
Bolero - A Journey Celebrating Creativity, was created to celebrate the 30th anniversary of the White Cloud Studio of New York, the world's first center of the GYROTONIC® Method.  Juliu Horvath choreographs protagonists Elisabetta Carnevale, Prima Ballerina of the White Cloud Opera in Rome, and Jackson Kellogg.
Bolero is inspired by texts written by the same Juliu Horvath: a journey into his own "self",” retracing the Master and Choreographer’s personal artistic path.
The choreography was born from the desire to celebrate both the "Creativity of Being" and the creative force of the Universe.  The show is composed of three interconnected sections, each following the choreography of Horvath and other interpreters.
The GYROTONIC® Method will serve as active element of the performance, with GYROKINESIS® sequences designed as tools to express the harmony of the dance. American and European dancers will join the Italian team, united by the common experience of the GYROTONIC® Method.
Any kind of contribution is highly appreciated and represents a fundamental step towards our funding goal. Share this adventure with us, and share it with your friends and on social media!
A big thank you, 
The White Cloud Opera Team
GYROTONIC® and GYROKINESIS® are registered trademarks of Gyrotonic Sales Corp and are used with their permission.

story:
Rain of Terror Productions presents: S.E.R.I.A.L (14 Plots)

Rain of Terror Productions is a performance group that uses extensive historical research, actor/director collaboration, and a juxtaposed locations to produce theatrical works based on historical events. We believe that telling these gruesome and horrific narratives through performance allows audiences to fully appreciate and experience the characters' experiences. 

S.E.R.I.A.L. (14 Plots) is an original dark-comedy that follows Harvey Macintosh and Beth Kelman, two serial killers in rural Virginia, 1973. Written by both actor and director, this immersive performance will allow the audience an up-close-and-personal experience with our serial murderers. 

OUR TEAM!

Playwrights: Syd Freiberger, Derek Sherry, Cayleigh Hearth

Actors:
Harvey Macintosh - Derek Sherry
Beth Kelman - Cayleigh Hearth
Lucy Hatcher - Rosie Allston-Follansbee
Penelope De'Fleur - Christina Quoka
Everett Tracey - Soren Correia

Production team:
Creator/Director - Syd Freiberger
Stage Manager - Lacey Szerlip
Fight Director - Brian Bowyer
Costume Designer - Rosie Allston-Follansbee
Sound Design - Francis Pace-Nunez 
Lighting Design - William Spitzer
Makeup Design - Christina Quoka
Technical Director - Amy Janos
Marketing Director - Al Duncan 
Board ops - Ashley Driscoll, Nicole Kaouris 
Ushers - Michelle Angelo, Matthew McCormick

BUDGET: $550

Budget Breakdown:

  • $150 - Costumes/Props
  • $300 - Set (wood, sheets, mulch, garden, walls)
  • $100 - Hospitality, safety, misc.

If we are unable to attain our goal, the money we raise will go towards our set first, and any left over will be used for minimal costuming.

Perks for Donating! 

  • $5 - Mention in program
  • $10 - Poster, Mention in program
  • $20 - Reserved seat (1-2), Poster, Mention in program
  • $50 - Signed production photo, Reserved seat (1-2), Poster, Mention in program
  • $70 - Thank you from Director, Signed production photo, Reserved seat (1-2), Poster, Mention in program
  • $100 - Signed copy of script, Thank you from Director, Signed production photo, Reserved seat (1-2), Poster, Mention in program

Can't help us out by donating? No problem! You can share this Indiegogo page on all major social media platforms, or you can come see the show (here's the event page!). Thank you so much for taking the time to read; we hope you can support us in creating historical and experimental theatre!

story:
Short Summary

We are Mysterious Guest Theatre company. 

Set up by Megan Gordon and Tash McPhillips, whom are both Drama and Performance Graduates from Queen Margaret University. 

The Black Queen is an important play to the horror genre, by bringing back the great classic style of the Grand Guignol, to the modern stage. Breathing new life into this classic and terrifying style of theatre. 

Your contribution shall help us to achieve staging our first production in Horror Fest. All the contributions shall go toward, building the elaborate set, recording our original soundtrack, to fund marketing, by making posters and flyers to advertise the production in and around Edinburgh. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break Down:

  • Building and sourcing an elaborate set, to record an original soundtrack, to fund the construction and sourcing of costume and props, to print advertising posters and flyers of the production.
  • We are a new and exciting company bringing back an old classic horrifying style of theatre to the modern stage. 
  • If we do not reach our entire goal, all of the money shall still go towards all of the listed technical requirements for the show. 
  • By contributing to our show you shall be rewarded in return.
  • If you donate £3-£7 You shall get free entry to the show.
  • If you donate £8-£12 You shall get free entry and front row seats, there shall be ten front row seats per show.
  • If you donate £13 and above you shall get free entry, a front row seat and a free meet and greet with the cast and crew after the show. 

The Impact

  • We believe that bringing back Grand Guignol to the centre stage of horror. 
  • We have had a great success in producing show within our four years at Queen Margaret University, across many genres of theatre and gaining the skills needed to be a well run company across all elements of the theatre.
  • Although as a company we are knew, we have a great history of experience of working in the theatre, inside and outside of University including multiple shows in the Fringe. We have a vision of bringing old forgotten styles of theatre into the modern world. 

Risks & Challenge

A challenge could be putting on the technical tricks of The Grand Guignol theatre, an example of this would be creating realistic effects of gore. 

Through rehearsals and practice we aim to create a realistic show as possible for our audiences, with the generous contributions we shall aim to achieve  the most horrifying play possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute with money, yet there are many other ways you can contribute to our campaign.

You can like us on

FaceBook: @mystery.GuestTheatre 

Instagram: @MysteriousGuest 

You can like, and share our posts to help get the word out to your friends and family.

story:
Biografía.

 

Soy bailarina e interprete Venezolana de Danza Contemporánea, inicie mis estudios en la universidad Nacional Experimental de las artes, en donde aprendí acerca de las diferentes técnicas con maestros como Félix Oropeza, Hilse León, Inés Rojas, Rafael González y Rafael Nieves que enriquecieron mi mundo de un gran aprendizaje, ellos me hicieron transformar partes de mi vida a diario para que lograra cosas a nivel físico y espiritual, por ello estoy muy agradecida ya que me han hecho creer en que con la danza se puede lograr transmitir un mensaje más allá de la palabra.

Para mí la danza se trata de seres humanos comunes haciendo cosas irreales posibles. Con el tiempo fui bailando con varios proyectos importantes tales como una producción de la compañía  Danza Hoy llamada Otto el Pirata, siendo bailarina invitada en las compañías Neodanza de caracas y caracas Rojas Laboratorio, por último en la compañía Teresa Danza Contemporánea que hace vida en las salas del Teatro Teresa Carreño donde me hicieron una persona diferente, mi mente se desarrolló entendiendo las miles de posibilidades que existen en el cuerpo para el movimiento y de cómo una interprete en danza contemporánea es capaz de expresar y darte a profundidad cada parte de su esencia. Dentro de la formación corporal y otras actividades que nutren la vida la gimnasia rítmica ha estado muy presente como atleta de la selección de mi estado y luego formando parte del equipo de entrenadoras de la Federación Venezolana de Gimnasia rítmica haciendo aportes coreográficos para mejorar los esquemas de sus series. Ahora es tiempo de seguir nutriendo el conocimiento acerca del cuerpo y la danza para no detener los procesos de estudio y exploración  de nuestra actividad como individuos para construir más proyectos dentro de este mundo. 

Biography

I’m a Venezuelan dancer and interpreter of the contemporary movement. I started my studies in the National Experimental University of Arts, where I learned about different techniques with masters Félix Oropeza, Hilse León, Inés Rojas, Rafael González and Rafael Nieves. They have enlightened my world with knowledge and transformed parts of my life to accomplish goals in a physical and spiritual level. I’m pleased to admit they have made me grow and believe that dance can transmit a message beyond the written and spoken word. For me, dance is about human beings creating impossibilities. With time I started dancing around various important projects such as “Otto el Pirata”, a production from the company “Danza Hoy”; I was also invited to dance with companies like “Neodanza de Caracas” and “Caracas Rojas Laboratorio”, at last in the company “Teresa Danza Contemporanea”, with performances coming to life in the rooms of the Teresa Carreño theatre. All these experiences made me a different person. My mind started understanding the possibilities within the body to create movement and how a contemporary dance interpreter is capable of expressing and addressing every piece of her essence. Within the corporal formation and other activities that nourish life, rhythmic gymnastics has always been present in my life. As an athlete for the state and later being part of the team of coaches of the Venezuelan Federation of Rhythmics Gymnastics, I contributed as a choreographer to improve their series.

En el presente año

Este año me atreví a enviar una solicitud a un Festival Internacional de movimiento organizado por Técnicas de Movimiento (TDM) llamado ATLAS que se llevara a cabo en Guanajuato, México con una duración de 9 días en la fecha del  2  al 10 de agosto del 2018. Atlas es un retiro de entrenamiento para profesionales con pedagogos provenientes de Europa, Asia y Latinoamérica, que han creado herramientas para la escena contemporánea mundial, seleccionando a solo 60 artistas a nivel mundial.

Para  gran sorpresa  seleccionaron y aceptaron la participación dentro  del festival entre estos 60 artistas, para expandir y fortalecer las bases que con dedicación y voluntad se adquieren. Estoy dispuesta a descubrir nuevas capacidades y habilidades otorgando todo lo que se tiene junto a estos grandes coreógrafos y maestros del mundo. El festival se basa en 11 horas de entrenamiento que solo un cuerpo con alto nivel de resistencia física puede dar hasta el final.

In The Current Year

This year I decided to send my application to ATLAS, an International Movement Festival, organized by Techniques of Movement, which will be organized in Guanajuato, Mexico with a duration of 9 days (August 2, 2018 - August 10, 2018). ATLAS is a training program for professional educators from Europe, Asia and Latin America, who developed tools for the contemporary scene world wide. To my surprise my application was approved to participate alongside 60 other great artists, to expand and straighten our skills. I’m more than open to discover new abilities, giving my best performance with the help of great choreographers and masters of the world. The festival consists of 11 hours of hard work and training that only high level physical resistance dancers can manage.

 Participación en el taller

La participación en este taller es una representación de Venezuela en la que se va a aprender acerca de diferentes técnicas de movimiento creadas por los coreógrafos y el cómo aplicarlas en cada momento diferente de la danza, abrir las puertas del conocimiento para elevar el nivel de las aptitudes internas y físicas del cuerpo, absorber herramientas para el momento de composiciones coreográficas individuales y en grupo, Abrir un nuevo proceso de investigación y exploración grupal en la que se desarrollaran resultados que tendrán ganancia para la unión de distintas culturas. Estar presente en este festival es llenar de información un cuerpo que esta vivo, que se mueve, que es apto para todo lo nuevo para recibir y para dar.

Workshop

My participation in this festival would be as a representative of Venezuela, in which I will learn about different movement techniques and how to implement them during dance. Techniques that will open the doors to knowledge to elevate the level of internal and physical aptitudes; absorb tools for design of new choreographic compositions; and open new investigatory and exploratory group processes that will fortify a cultural union. To being present in this festival is to enrich a body full of life, that moves, and is willing for all the new experiences to come.

Valor del Festival

 

El festival tiene un valor monetario de 800 $ que aseguran  un lugar a donde llegar y hospedarte toda la semana además de cubrir la alimentación del desayuno, almuerzo y la cena. El boleto de avión con escalas tiene un monto de 1500$ sujeto a cambios de que puedan subir porque en Venezuela no se mantiene ningún precio fijo.  Estas dos cosas dan un presupuesto de 2300$ que se deben conseguir para el traslado de Venezuela a México  y confirmar la participación dentro del festival. (Presupuesto).

Presupuesto.

800$                   Alojamiento, Alimentación y traslado entra la posada y el sitio de los talleres

1500$                 Pasaje de Venezuela a México con escalas

Total: 2300$

Value Of The Workshop

The festival is worth $800, which ensures lodgement for a week, plus basic nutrition (breakfast, lunch and dinner). The flight has a price of $1500 (subject to price changes); for a total budget of $2300 for transportation and to guarantee the participation in the festival. Budget: $800 For accommodation, meals and transportation. $1500 Plane tickets from Venezuela to Mexico (Non direct flight) Total: $2300 

Meta.

El objetivo de este proyecto es recaudar el  total del monto del presupuesto para hacer posible la presencia y asistencia de una bailarina dispuesta a dar todo lo que tiene dentro, con unas ganas increíbles de querer aprender para crecer aún más a nivel artístico, ampliar conocimientos acerca de todo lo que proviene de la danza.

 La asistencia a este festival posee  un mérito artístico muy grande que trasciende del conocimiento, significa que tenemos la oportunidad de no abandonar ni por un segundo lo que en nuestro corazón existe, es una riqueza invaluable. La posibilidad de recibir la información para seguir dándola a cada persona que puedas hallar con ganas de abrir la puerta a aprender y deseosa de creer que puedes ser la mejor versión de ti.

Goals

The goal of this project is to gather the total amount for the budget to make possible my participation in the festival. I am a determined and working dancer, with a deniable thrive to learn and grown within my artistic field. The assistance to this festival transcend beyond knowledge, assisting dancers to reach what’s in our hearts. The opportunity to receive and pass along the knowledge, will inspire other to be the best version of themselves and to open doors beyond their imagination.

story:
Bringing Summer Musicals Back to Little Falls

In spring 2019, local theatre supporters created a new nonprofit organization, "Little Falls Summer Musical," and began the process of putting on a show -- specifically The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee (Aug. 8-10, 2019). This will be the first summer community musical theatre production in more than a decade. Its success depends on volunteer help, cash and in-kind donations, and sponsorship support by community members who support the arts. That's where our Indiegogo campaign comes in.

What We Need

We need funding for three main purposes:

  • Direct costs of putting on The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee, including such things as show licensing fees, microphone rental, and materials for sets, props, and costumes, as well as ticket promotion costs.
  • Administrative costs including government filing fees, financing fees, and insurance.
  • Costs for next year's show!

What You Get

In exchange for supporting LF Summer Musical with your contribution, we'd like to thank you in the following ways (with your permission):

  • Acknowledgment of your donation in the show programme, among the "Director's Circle" of financial supporters;
  • Art works created by local artists to commemorate LF Summer Musical 2019; and
  • The opportunity to see summer musicals in Little Falls!

Local Talent, Local Enrichment

LFSM promotes arts education and enrichment by providing creative opportunities for local artists and technicians, and cultural entertainment for local audiences. Our strong ties with local performing arts and education communities ensure that LFSM attracts first-rate talent for each production, and reaches a broad Central Minnesota audience.

Community Collaboration

In addition to the dozens of people involved in show production, many local organizations and individuals have supported the launch and progress of LF Summer Musical, for example: St. Francis Music Center, the Little Falls Convention and Visitor's Bureau, and Little Falls Community Services, as well as Great River Arts, Morrison County Historical Society, the Charles A. Lindbergh House and Museum, Tony's 1st Ave Custom Framing, Gary Block Tours, and many more.  This truly is a community-wide endeavor, and your Indiegogo donation is an important part of it -- not only helping LF Summer Musical to produce shows, but also as a vote of support that will inspire others to support us and attend our shows. In this way your donation has multiplying benefits for first-rate musical theatre in the community.

Nonprofit Governance

LFSM’s founders and officers include professionals with substantial experience
in development and management of nonprofits, community projects,
and events and performances. Professional management will ensure LFSM
is a sustainable and successful part of the local arts and cultural community.

Risks & Challenges

Little Falls Summer Musical relies on the support of many businesses, organizations, and individuals. An adequate level of community support of every kind will determine not only whether the 2019 show is successful, but whether LF Summer Musical can afford to produce additional shows in the future.  Some factors affecting that support are beyond our ability to control. For example, no matter how much promotion we do, ticket sales depend on factors that are difficult to predict and mostly out of our hands. 

The LF Summer Musical team is managing these risks by taking a comprehensive and diverse approach involving many members of the community. A group of experienced advisers has provided input, guidance, and space to meet and rehearse, as well as help promoting the initiative and selling tickets. Additionally we are pursuing every practical source of funding, to ensure that if any single funding source falls short, others will be there to ensure costs are adequately covered.

The LF Summer Musical team is comprised of professionals with decades of experience in business management, publicity and communications, and show production and performance. This team is mobilized and committed to overcoming all the challenges of producing first-rate musical theatre.

Other Ways You Can Help

Your Indiegogo contribution is one of several important ways you can contribute to the success of LF Summer Musical:

  • Donate any amount, 100% tax-deductible via our GoFundMe campaign: www.gofundme.com/lfsummermusical
  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Tell people about it and ask them to support LF Summer Musical.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word in your social networks.
  • COME AND SEE THE SHOW and BRING OTHERS WITH YOU! Tell everyone to buy a ticket! This is the most important kind of support you can give!
story_txt:
Bringing Summer Musicals Back to Little Falls
In spring 2019, local theatre supporters created a new nonprofit organization, "Little Falls Summer Musical," and began the process of putting on a show -- specifically The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee (Aug. 8-10, 2019). This will be the first summer community musical theatre production in more than a decade. Its success depends on volunteer help, cash and in-kind donations, and sponsorship support by community members who support the arts. That's where our Indiegogo campaign comes in.

What We Need
We need funding for three main purposes:

Direct costs of putting on The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee, including such things as show licensing fees, microphone rental, and materials for sets, props, and costumes, as well as ticket promotion costs.
Administrative costs including government filing fees, financing fees, and insurance.
Costs for next year's show!

What You Get
In exchange for supporting LF Summer Musical with your contribution, we'd like to thank you in the following ways (with your permission):

Acknowledgment of your donation in the show programme, among the "Director's Circle" of financial supporters;
Art works created by local artists to commemorate LF Summer Musical 2019; and

story:
Short Summary

The Shifting Point Theater Company is a non-profit association, created by theater directors, theater  desingners and actors with the mission to make an independent theater enviroment in Romania, Transylvania to find new ways, directions, places for young artist who are in the beginning of they journey. 

Since 2016 we have participated in several theater projects. The next project we have organized for the second time this year, depicting a 12-days theater camp retreat. The camp is located in a beautiful pine forest called Barakasza. The camp aims to give an opportunity for artists working in theater / wishing to work in the mountains, where they can deepen their knowledge without expectations, correspondences, they can exchange experiences and they can design common projects. 

This year's theme will be the drama of Anton Chekhov, entitled The Cherry Orchard. From this drama the participants can choose between scenes and work with peers. After within a specified period of time, they must to put on stage, taking into account the "theater spaces" around them (trees, rocks, streams, hills, fields, flowers, etc.), the sounds of the forest, noises (ringing brook, bird singing, etc.). The camp is an opportunity to try a variety of theatrical jobs, so the task is not only to direct a theater pice, but also you can try yourself as an actor, visual designer, dramaturge, etc.. The camp program also includes the study of theoretical texts of The Cherry Orchard. The past year proved to be very useful for the retreat, the lack of electricity, hot water, and other comfort factors,it helped that the time spent there to be saturated with energy, creativity, knowledge and experiences. 

We are a non-profit association, our successes so far we achieved whit our own pocket and a lot of work, we need donation to be able to offer even more opportunities for the participants this year. The travel, stay, food, theater tools and sets, the camp lieders payment cost money, every little donation are accepted with great love.

 

For the donators we provide free stay in a beautiful transylvanian place, participation on theater workshops and trekking with guide in the wilderness.

story:
Short Summary

At the request of the aquatic community, TVRPD launched this campaign to allow the community to generate interest in swimming during non-summer months and to raise the funds needed to pay for the operations of Dye in October.

What We Need

Here are TVRPD's projected costs for the month of October:

  • $800 Electricity
  • $2,000 Gas
  • $3,500 Lifeguards
  • $1,100 Chemicals
  • $500 Maintenance
  • $320 Instructors
    =$8,220

Each $30 donation gets you a 1 month pass to Dye for the month of October. If the goal isn't reached, we don't receive the funds (and you are not out $30) and the pool will close on September 24 and reopen on April 1, 2017.

Should the goal be met, the operational hours for October will be:

5:00 - 7:00 AM - Lap Swim (M-F)

12:00-1:00 PM - Lap Swim/Open Swim (M-F)

6:00-7:00 PM -Aqua Aerobics/Lap Swim (M-TH)

7:00-8:00 PM - Open Swim/Lap Swim (M-TH)

Saturdays 1:00-4:00 PM Open Swim/Lap Swim

If the goal is met, you can claim your monthly pass(es) by bringing proof of your contribution (e.g. credit card statement) to the TVRPD office during office hours.

story:
Where your contributions will be used:

We're proud of our accomplishments with this festival production so far and your contributions will help us bring  a full scale  production of DEATH BE NOT LOUD!, a contemporary Southern comedy -  home to San Francisco for it's West Coast premiere. This is one of our largest production to date and we hope you'll be a part of laying the tracks for this new journey. Last fall we joined with Entropy Productions and 3Girls Theatre Company to bring the world premiere of Susan Jackson's TAKEN. This fall we're proud to announce our continued collaboration with Entropy Productions and 3Girls Theatre on DEATH BE NOT LOUD!.  

Thanks to our collaboration with producing partner 3Girls Theatre, your contributions are now tax-deductible!!!

About our history:

We've had the pleasure of working with some of the best theater companies, theatre makers and artists the Bay Area has to offer. In 2013, we were invited to New York City for Altruistic Theatre Company's Bare Knuckle Theatre Fest. We've been working to build creative alliances with other companies including the immersion experience theatre producers, Incentives to Intrigue. We collaborate with writers, directors and producers from Entropy Productions, Wily West Productions, Pacifica Table Readers, Pear Avenue Theater, PianoFight Productions and 3Girls Theatre. In 2014, we were invited to participate in the Eugene O'Neill Foundation's Eugene O' Neill Festival where we presented A RAZING IN MISSOURI, written and directed by Susan Jackson.  In 2015 we were invited back to NYC for Midtown's Mid-Winter Theatre Festival. We made our critically acclaimed Washington, DC debut in July 2016 with DEATH BE NOT LOUD! earning rave reviews from The Washington Post & DC Metro Theatre Arts:  

“Under the direction of Wesley Cayabyab, the two recognizable and credible characters are comfortable in their own skin.”

-Roger Catlin, The Washington Post

“Susan Jackson’s new play DEATH BE NOT LOUD! – Produced by the Southern Railroad Theatre Company and billed as a “contemporary Southern comedy” – is a sweet reflection on love and loss, featuring two gifted actors...”

-Ravelle Brickman, DC Metro Theatre Arts

About the production:

Meet Red and Marion, as different as they can be - "People are worse than anybody!" - Marion's take on the world after a few martinis collides with Red's pragmatism and profanity: "You just gotta laugh, goddamn it!" Will they find Southern Comfort as they story down the railroad tracks of life?

Written by Susan Jackson

DEATH BE NOT LOUD! is Directed by Wesley Cayabyab

Featuring: Diana Brown as Red and Susan Jackson as Marion.

Production Manager: Stacy Marshall

The West Coast premiere of DEATH BE NOT LOUD!, a contemporary Southern comedy will preview on November 3. Opens November 4, continuing through November 18. Performances on Fridays & Saturdays at 8 pm, Sundays at 2 pm. Thursday, November 16 at 8 pm.

Your contributions will go to prepare the production for our 3 week San Francisco run of DEATH BE NOT LOUD!.

Our Goal of $6,000 will go to pay for rental of the Phoenix Theatre. Set design and construction, lights and sound production, insurance, production staff and to compensate our director and collaborators. Also to pay for advertising to market our production and to document the project.

In thanks for your support:

You'll receive inside access to the production process through special posts and video updates. Invitations to closed rehearsals.  At certain levels, contributors will enjoy credit in the program and on our website for DEATH BE NOT LOUD!, VIP tickets to opening night.  A Southern "Comfort Food Social" with the company of DEATH BE NOT LOUD!. 

All of you will receive our sincere gratitude!

As an independent producing company, we are used finding ways to self fund. Even if we don't receive our entire funding goal, any contribution will help us to make this production possible. Your support and contributions also ensure the continued artistic growth of the Southern Railroad Theatre Company.

The Impact:

Your contributions will go to help us bring a full scale version of this critically acclaimed festival production home This is the second full scale production we have undertaken and we hope you'll be a part of laying the tracks for this new journey.

This opportunity  will expand our producing knowledge and experience.  We are thrilled to forge these new creative partnerships as we continue to increase our artistic community in the San Francisco Bay Area and across the nation.

As always a portion of our proceeds will go in support of a charity.  In the past, we've supported Tornado Relief in Joplin, MO., Puppy Rescue Mission, SF Suicide Prevention and Rocket Dog Rescue.  At this time we'll be keeping our charitable efforts close to home by helping to support Napa/Sonoma counties animal rescue and support needed as a result of the devastating fires.

We're excited to face the challenge of bringing this show home with our producing partners.  Co-producers, Brown and Jackson have presented at New York City, Washington, DC and San Francisco theatre festivals as well as producing smaller scale runs of productions locally. They will rely on what they've learned from those experiences and the considerable experience of Entropy Productions and 3Girls Theatre Company.

Even if we don't receive our entire funding goal, any contribution will help us to bring this west coast premiere production to San Francisco. And your support ensures the continued artistic growth of the Southern Railroad Theatre Company.

Other Ways You Can Help:

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially:

Your good wishes, sharing our story on social media are just as valuable and appreciated!

Indiegogo share tools are a great way to do just that!

We sure thank you for your support!

Diana Brown and Susan Jackson, Co-Producers, Southern Railroad Theatre Company

Wesley Cayabyab, Co-Producer, Entropy Productions

AJ Baker, Co-Producer, 3Girls Theatre Company

 

Southern Railroad Theatre Company has been presenting award winning, critically acclaimed theatre in the Bay Area and beyond since 2008. 

We’re drawn to work that emphasizes how underneath it all, we’re the same, human. Join us for some “Comfort Food Entertainment”. We sure hope ya’ll come see, you’re in for a damn good time!

story:
Why Should I Care About Right Now Tonight?

This show started because we all got tired of hearing how boring Ottawa is while finding ourselves surrounded by so many creative, hard-working folks. We were experiencing art and culture we wouldn’t be seeing anywhere else in Canada and wanted our friends to love these artists, makers and musicians as much as we did. That's why we're inviting our audience to get to know some of the best unknown, underground, and emerging talent that Ottawa has to offer.

RNTN is an opportunity to get to know your neighbors, find your new favorite band, and share a few laughs about this crazy capital we call home. When you support RNTN, you’re supporting independent creatives across the city, while simultaneously helping build a community platform.

 

Fringe Fest & The New Season

RNTN is proud to premiere Season II of our show at the Ottawa Fringe Fest! We're excited to be coming back better than ever in 2018 with all-new content from the best up-and-coming artists and creators in Ottawa. 

Catch us at Academic Hall on UOttawa campus from June 14-24!

 

How You Can Help

We would love it if you could donate to our campaign - but  if not, we get it - we’re broke too! That’s why we’ve created plenty of other ways for you to help and support Right Now Tonight.

For starters, you can like and share our Facebook,  Twitter, or Instagram.

You can come see the show in June! Click here to get a list of dates and times we’ll be performing - you can even buy tickets! (coming soon)

You can share this campaign on all of your social media accounts using this link: https:/igg.me/at/RNTN 

You can email us to let us know who you want to see on our show! We’re always looking for the latest and hottest Ottawa acts! Give us a shout at rightnowtonightshow@gmail.com .

 

Budget

RNTN has been funded entirely by our small staff up until now. Fringe Fest is our biggest undertaking to date, and as such we’re in need of a little extra help from our pals. We’re asking for $2500. These funds will ensure that we are able to fairly compensate all performers, artists, and guests who appear on the show, while simultaneously covering start-up costs.

 

 

The Team

RNTN is produced, written, and performed by a group of friends who got bored and wanted to do something good for their city in the desolate winter of 2015.

 

CHLOE BARKER is a producer, production manager, and host of RNTN. Born in Kitchener Ontario, Chloe moved to Ottawa in 2010 and immediately fell in love with the city. Her first acting gig was playing Juliet in her middle school’s production of Romeo and Juliet at the ripe age of 12. She has been a diva ever since.

 

NADER KADDOUR quit his job at the United Nations to play with puppets. Born in Ottawa, Nader proceeded to live in nearly every neighborhood in the city before immigrating to Hull to found RNTNstudios™. He is our producer, creative director, and host.

 

THEODORE CLEMENT is a producer and official dean of chuckles at RNTN. He was born in Ottawa and hasn’t changed since. He used to be a writer but refuses to continue until you agree to illustrate his graphic novel.

 

JOHN MCCLELLAND is the artistic director of RNTN. Born in Ames, Iowa, this Mid-Western transplant stole our hearts with his ingenuity and creativity. 

 

STEPHANIE BOURASSA is RNTN's puppet master. Currently located in Montreal, Stephanie lived in Ottawa for years, making a mark on the community as an event coordinator, creator, and friendly extrovert.

Born in Ames, Iowa, this Mid-Western transplant stole our hearts with his ingenuity and creativity.  STEPHANIE BOURASSA is RNTN's puppet master. Currently located in Montreal, Stephanie lived in Ottawa for years, making a mark on the community as an event coordinator, creator, and friendly extrovert.
